Secluded, they'll look at the item and consider if its valuable or not. If it is valuable they'll either sell it, trade it, or give it away to another Lynian tribe. If it isn't valuable they may just intentionally leave it behind somewhere random. If items are stolen by a Melynx than there is chance that one could get it back by looking for a crude statue of a Felyne with paint on it. Some items can be recovered here.

They live in harmony with the lighter-toned species of Lynian, the Felynes. The Melynx and Felynes seem to be hostile towards the other Lynian Species, the {@creature Shakalaka|MHMM}, as they are never seen living in the same area together, though all three species live in the same environments.

items.name: Ration (1 day)
entries: Эти пайки состоят из сухофруктов и какого-либо вида мяса животных, пригодного для длительного путешествия.

items.name: Coins
entries: The melynx has {@dice 2d6} silver pieces on them.

items.name: Secret Stash+
entries: A pouch carried by a melynx. Full of miscellaneous junk. Can be sold for 50 gp.

items.name: Shock Trap
entries: {@item shock trap|AGMH|Item found in (AGtMH p.57)}.

trait.name: Oiled Body
entries: The mizutsune has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mizutsune makes three attacks, one with its bite and two with its tail. It can make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. On hit, the creature is {@condition Slick|MHMM}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the mizutsune can't use its bite on another target.

action.name: Bubble Prison
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The creature is {@condition Slick|MHMM} and enclosed in a bubble of shimmering force for 1 minute or until the bubble is destroyed. Nothing, not physical Objects, energy, or other spell effects, can pass through the bubble, in or out, though a creature in the Sphere can breathe there. A creature inside of the bubble has disadvantage on attacks due to its slippery nature. The bubble has AC 15, 30 hit points, resistance to bludgeoning damage, immunity to poison and psychic damage, and vulnerable to piercing damage. At the end of the mizutsune's turn all bubbles rise 10 feet higher into the air.

action.name: Hydropump {@recharge 5}
entries: The mizutsune releases a high pressure stream of water in an 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage and not on a successful one.

reaction.name: Tail Sweep
entries: When a create is slick and starts its turn within 10 feet of the mizutsune. It can use its reaction to sweep its tail, hitting the targets legs. The target must then make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

Like most other Leviathans, Mizutsune has a long, slender body. However, it is one of the few Leviathans to actually have fur on its body. This fur covers its chest, underbelly, legs and tail. Its scales are light colored and resemble those of a fish. Its head has a long snout and is beautifully adorned by many fin-like appendages. These fins are pink with yellow markings, and they can also be seen on its back and tail. Its feet are said to be quite different from other Leviathans and allow Mizutsune to move swiftly on land.

Mizutsune's most unique adaption is its ability to produce bubbles. It is able to produce the bubbles by using special fluid secretions, produced from its own body along with water, and rubbing its hairs in the secretions. These stiff yet soft purple hairs are found on its chest, tail, legs, and sides. The hairs are used for sliding on the fluids it produces, spreading the fluids, and even using the fluids to produce more bubbles. Mizutsune can also breath these bubbly fluids from its mouth. It is known to use the bubbles it produces both offensively and defensively in battle. It uses the bubbles to help it move faster and to make it more flexible in battle, while simultaneously impeding the movement of any foes. In order to stop itself quickly while moving, Mizutsune has special hook-like claws that allow it to stop sliding quickly to face threats and not leave itself open. Despite Mizutsune's strange appearance, the fins it has actually act as receptors for detecting the presence of predators and prey coming through vibrations in the secretions. Like a snake, Mizutsune's teeth are recurved to prevent prey from escaping easily. Its jaws are even designed like a snake to an extent, even being able to open its mouth wide and swallow some large prey. It can also fire pressurized jets of water from its mouth, much like {@creature Plesioth|MHMM}.

Mizutsune are rather calm in nature until provoked. They prefer to be left alone resting near large bodies of water, while covered in their special secretions. They prefer to avoid confrontations, however, will defend themselves if need be. Once a threat has left, Mizutsune won't chase after the threat but will instead let it go. Though Mizutsune are usually calm, they are known to turn aggressive during Breeding Season. Mizutsune become aggressive or even berserk during their Breeding Season. In this season, it is not a good idea to go fishing from them being known to injure people due to their blind rage. Male Mizutsune have large fins and are able to flash their fins red to show emotion to the female Mizutsune, in order to attract them.

items.name: Mizutsune Scale
entries: {@i Gourmand.} While attuned to this armor, you double the amount of days you can go without food or water before suffering a level of {@condition exhaustion}.

items.name: Bubble Fluid
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can cast the {@spell Otiluke's Resilient Sphere} spell once per day.

items.name: Mizutsune Pelt
entries: While wearing this armor, you ignore difficult terrain from spells like {@spell grease} or other environmental effects that cause the ground to become slippery. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition slick|MHMM} condition.

items.name: Mizutsune Purplefur
entries: Пока вы носите эту броню, у вас есть устойчивость к урону холодом.

items.name: Mizutsune Plate
entries: While attuned to this armor, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks that rely on moving silently.

items.name: Mizutsune Water Gem
entries: {@i Bubbly+.} While attuned to this armor, you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. Also the durations from slowing effects, such as the {@spell slow} spell or a copper dragon's breath attack, are reduced by half.

items.name: Mizutsune Claw
entries: Когда вы держите это оружие, вы получаете бонус +1 к броскам атаки заклинанием и игнорируете половину укрытия при атаке заклинанием.

items.name: Bubble Fluid
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, the creature must succeed a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition slick|MHMM}. A creature can use its action on itself or another adjacent creature to wipe off the liquid, removing the effect.

items.name: Mizutsune Tail
entries: This weapon has 5 runes. While holding it, you can use an action and expend 1 rune to speak its command word. For the next minute, you know the direction of the nearest creature hostile to you within 60 feet, but not its distance from you. The weapon can sense the presence of hostile creatures that are ethereal, {@condition Invisible}, disguised, or hidden, as well as those in plain sight. The effect ends if you stop holding the weapon. This weapon regains 1d4 + 1 expended runes daily at dawn.

items.name: Mizutsune Fin
entries: {@i (Hunting Horn only)} Your maximum cord length is increased by 1 when holding this weapon.

items.name: Mizutsune Plate
entries: {@i Crisis.} While suffering from an abnormal status effect, such as {@condition poisoned}, burning, slowed, {@condition blinded}, etc, all attacks and spells deal an extra 1d10 spell or weapon damage.

items.name: Mizutsune Water Gem
entries: {@i (spellcaster only)} While attuned to this weapon, you know the {@spell watery sphere|XGE} spell. If you prepare spells, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If this spell is not on your class list, the spell is nonetheless a class spell for you.

trait.name: Underground Charge
entries: If the monoblos moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature while underground, it can then make a horn attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the monoblos takes 30 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the monoblos hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The monoblos makes two attacks, one with its horn and one with its tail attack.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Violent Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: The monoblos roars loudly in a 10 foot radius around them. All creatures in this area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) thunder damage and become {@condition Deafened} for 1 minute on a failed saving throw or half as much on a successful one and is not {@condition deafened}.
A monocerous desert-dwelling wyvern, they have a brown, rock-hard texture to their shell.

While Monoblos have no breath attack, their roar is considered a lethal weapon itself. They are also very physically capable, able to fight off adventurers with horn-thrusts and tail-swings. Being able to tunnel beneath the sands of the Desert also means they can sneak up on any potential threats.
Monoblos are aggressive, and will attack adventurers on sight. They are quick to anger, causing their crown to be become inflamed with red streaks.

items.name: Monoblos Carapace
entries: {@i Botanist+.} When you successfully gather a {@table plants|AGMH|plant} resource, you gather an extra 1d4 more.

items.name: Monoblos Thoracic
entries: Пока вы носите эту броню, у вас есть устойчивость к урону холодом.

items.name: Scarlet Finehorn
entries: While you're wearing this armor, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

items.name: Blos Medulla
entries: {@i Alert.} You can't be surprised while you are conscious.

items.name: Blos Gem
entries: You have a +1 bonus to your AC while you wear this armor.

items.name: Monoblos Heart
entries: {@i Adrenaline.} The first time you drop below half of your hit point maximum in combat, you gain a rush of adrenaline. On your next turn your movement speed doubles and you can take one extra action.

items.name: Monoblos Carapace
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, you can perform the somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a shield in one or both hands.

items.name: Monoblos Thoracic
entries: Whenever you have advantage on a melee attack roll with this weapon and hit, you can knock the target {@condition prone} if the lower of the two d20 rolls would also hit the target.

items.name: Scarlet Finehorn
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d6 piercing damage.

items.name: Blos Medulla
entries: {@i Charger.} When you use your action to {@action Dash}, you can use a bonus action to shove a creature.

items.name: Blos Gem
entries: {@i (Bowgun only) Load Up+.} While attuned to this weapon, you increase the maximum capacity for all of your ammo by 2.

items.name: Monoblos Heart
entries: {@i Critical Eye.} Дальность критического удара ваших атак оружием увеличивается на 1.

trait.name: Sure-footed
entries: The moofah has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

Moofah are docile alpaca-like creatures known for their long shaggy fur. Males have longer horns than females. Domesticated Moofah have lighter-colored fur than their wild counterparts, and wear colored bows and bells.

items.name: Moofah Fur
entries: Пока вы носите эту броню, получаемый вами урон от холода уменьшается на 2.

items.name: Moofah Horn
entries: Your weapon attacks deal an extra 1 lightning damage.

items.name: Raw Meat
entries: При приготовлении обеспечивает 2-дневный рацион.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The gekko sheds dim light in a 1-foot radius around it.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} попадание, радиус действия 5 футов, одна цель. {@h}1 колющее повреждение.

trait.name: Mushroom Hunter
entries: The mosswine advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell when hunting mushrooms.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

Mosswine are small, moss-covered pigs. They have a gray, spiky head plate. Mosswine are known to have a great appetite for mushrooms. Hunters and marketers commonly observe them to identify an area of Special {@table Mushrooms|AGMH}. Mosswine are docile by nature, but will attack if provoked. They are mostly hunted for their mushroom-tracking abilities and their meat.

items.name: Mosswine Hide
entries: {@i Mushroomancer.} While wearing this armor you can digest {@table mushrooms|AGMH} that would otherwise be inedible and gain their advantageous effects. The more Mosswine Hide materials equipped in your armor or trinkets, the more mushrooms you can eat.

entries.name: 1 Mosswine Hide
items: Toadstool, {@i You regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns for 1 minute.}

entries.name: 2 Mosswine Hides
items: Nitroshroom, {@i Your Strength score increases by +2 for 1 minute (to a maximum of 20).}
Parashroom, {@i Your AC becomes 13 + your Dexterity modifier for the next 8 hours.}

entries.name: 3 Mosswine Hides
items: Гриб Хаоса, {@i You are {@condition poisoned} на 1 час и получает 5 временных хит-пойнтов за уровень персонажа в течение следующих 10 минут}.
Bindshroom, {@i Your speed increases by 10 feet for 1 hour.}
Exciteshroom, {@i Provides one of the other mushroom effects, roll a d6 to see which one:}

items.name: Raw Meat
entries: При приготовлении обеспечивает 2-дневный рацион.

items.name: Blue Mushroom
entries: {@table mushrooms|AGMH|Item found in (AGtMH p.70)}

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The najarala has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Surround
entries: The najarala can freely enter a large or smaller creatures space. If the creature is within the inner space of the najarala it is surrounded. A surrounded creature is trapped (escape {@dc 17}) by the najarala's body. A creature can also escape by flying or burrowing out of the area.

trait.name: Squeeze
entries: As a bonus action, the najarala can use its constrict against a {@condition grappled} creature or one within the najarala's space.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The najarala makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target. Or it makes two sonic scale attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the najarala can't constrict another target.

action.name: Sonic Scale
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) force damage and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition deafened} for 1 minute.

action.name: Sonic Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The najarala exhales a blast of force in a 90-line. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 39 ({@damage 11d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Najarala is a large Snake Wyvern with bright green skin adorned with large orange-yellow plates on its back and tail. It has a long serpentine body with small though fully functional fore- and hindlimbs that aid it in moving around on uneven ground. Najarala are stealthy hunters that ruthlessly ambush their targets. It has a large beak-like mouth similar to that of a parrot. This beak is used to rip chunks of flesh from its prey and then swallow said chunks whole. While feeding on prey, it will use its arms to hold on to its prey while ripping off chunks of flesh.

The length of a Najarala surpasses some of the largest leviathans such as {@creature Agnaktor|MHMM} or {@creature Lagiacrus|MHMM}. As many would notice these creatures have short, yet powerful arms and legs. At first glance these limbs appear to be useless but in reality they enable the creatures to support itself when rearing up. Another fascinating feature is that the creature has a specialized organ on its back that is vibrated by air and creates unique sound waves. This auditory organ has a biological effect in the surrounding area. Najarala have beautiful plates on both its neck and tail that will rattle when upset, giving unwelcome creatures an early warning. The plates on its tail can be thrown at its enemies and will explode creating a loud burst of sound like a sonic bomb. This will stun both prey and enemies alike.

items.name: Najarala Shell
entries: Пока вы носите эти доспехи, вы можете использовать свою реакцию или бонусное действие, чтобы получить сопротивление урону от огня до конца вашего следующего хода. Вы можете использовать это свойство дважды, восстанавливая его после длительного отдыха.

items.name: Najarala Hide
entries: {@i Earplugs.} Пока вы настроены на эту броню, вы можете использовать бонусное действие, чтобы наколдовать две затычки для ушей выбранной вами формы. Пока вы используете эти затычки, вы считаетесь {@condition deafened} и имеете преимущество при бросках спасбросков против урона от грома. Вы можете развеять затычки как бонусное действие, прекратив эффект оглушения.

items.name: N.Paralysis Sac
entries: You cannot be {@condition paralyzed} while you wear this armor.

items.name: Chilling Beak
entries: Пока вы носите эту броню, у вас есть сопротивление к некротическому урону.

items.name: Najarala Shell
entries: {@i Capturer.} When you capture a creature, you gain one additional material from it.

items.name: Najarala Fang
entries: Ваше оружие наносит дополнительные 1d4 косых повреждений.

items.name: Najarala Sounder
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d6 slashing damage.

items.name: N.Paralysis Sac
entries: This weapon has 3 runes which are regained every day at dawn. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you may expend a rune to have the target make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a fail the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and has its movement speed is reduced to 0 for 1 minute. The creature may repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

items.name: Najarala Marrow
entries: {@i Capture Expert.} {@item Tranq bomb|AGMH}s & {@item tranq ammo (1)|AGMH|ammo} roll an extra 3d8 when they hit a creature.

items.name: Chilling Beak
entries: {@i (Melee Weapon only)} When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to reduce the damage you deal by half to {@action grapple} the target.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the nakarkos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Poison Aura
entries: At the start of each of the nakarkos's turns, each creature within 5 feet of its body takes 11 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. A creature that touches the nakarkos body or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Bone Tentacles
entries: The nakarkos has two tentacles (Size. Large, AC 22, HP 30). Damaging a bone tentacle deals no damage to the nakarkos. When a bone tentacle reaches 0 hit points, it becomes a Broken Tentacle. As a bonus action, the tentacles retract underground and reappear in an unoccupied space within 15 feet of the narkarkos body.

trait.name: Broken Tentacles
entries: A broken tentacle has had the bones protecting it destroyed reducing its AC by 2. (Size. Large, AC 20). Damaging a broken tentacle deals damage to the nakarkos. At the end of the nakarkos turn, a broken tentacle retracts into the ground. It reappears at the start of the nakarkos next turn with the bones of a new creature, roll a {@dice d4} to determine what type of tentacle it becomes. On a 1, Lagiacrus Tentacle; On a 2, Glavenus Tentacle; On a 3, Uragaan Tentacle; On a 4, Brachydios Tentacle.

trait.name: True Face
entries: The Nakarkos is sunken into the ground, revealing only its body parts that are covered in dragon bone giving the appearance that it has "two heads" but nakarkos's true head is hidden away underground. When the nakarkos is below half of its maximum hit points (131), it will reveal its unprotected true face reducing its AC by 2 and replacing its multiattack and fire beam with:

items.name: Multiattack
entries: The nakarkos makes two tentacle attacks and one beak attack. It can replace its tentacle attack with a sticky mucus attack.

items.name: Fire Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: The nakarkos exhales a beam of fire in a 90-foot line that is 10-feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 50 ({@damage 9d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nakarkos makes two tentacle attacks. It can replace either of these attacks with a Sticky Mucus attack.

action.name: Sticky Mucus
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft. from tentacles location, one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage. On hit, the target is {@condition grappled} by the mucus (escape {@dc 20}).

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fire Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: The nakarkos tentacles release two beams of fire, one from each tentacle. Each beam fires in a 45-foot line that is 5-feet wide. Each creature in either line must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 ({@damage 8d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: The nakarkos uses one of the following tentacle attacks depending on which bones they are using:

items.name: Broken Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Lagiacrus Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) lightning damage.

items.name: Glavenus Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

items.name: Uragaan Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) blugeoning damage.

items.name: Brachydios Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and each creature within 5 feet of the target, including the target, must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Mucus Ball
entries: The narkarkos launches a ball of mucus from its back at a target. The target must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition restrained} by the mucus (escape {@dc 20}).

legendary.name: Tentacle Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The narkarkos makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Trample (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The narkarkos moves up to its speed, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking attacks of opportunity. Any creatures the narkarkos moves through must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

Nakarkos are massive cephalopod-like monsters. They have glowing yellow eyes, and massive, sharp beaks. They have blue skin with spots of turquoise bioluminescence. The most unique feature of a Nakarkos's body is its self-made covering of bones which it uses to protect and camouflage itself. Under normal circumstances, the Nakarkos's face cannot be seen. Its two primary tentacles are covered in vertebrae and tipped with skulls, creating the appearance of a two-headed skeletal dragon. Nakarkos have been reported in many different regions by eyewitnesses, though Nakarkos are known to make huge bone-covered lairs in caves. These lairs are known as Wyvern's End. Nakarkos are also known to be found in the sea.

Nakarkos easily assert themselves as top predators, no matter what the environment is. These Elder Dragons have been identified feeding on the armored prey, such as {@creature Uragaan|MHMM} and {@creature Diablos|MHMM}, and even top predators like {@creature Glavenus|MHMM}, {@creature Brachydios|MHMM}, and {@creature Agnaktor|MHMM}. Even monster species capable of flight aren't safe from this monster. The most shocking creatures these Elder Dragons have been found to take down are {@creature Shen Gaoren|MHMM} and {@creature Ceadeus|MHMM} pups. Other prey includes {@creature Hermitaur|MHMM} and {@creature Daimyo Hermitaur|MHMM}. The only real likely things that could potentially threaten a Nakarkos are other Elder Dragons like older Ceadeus, their only known predator.

Nakarkos are gluttons that can eat a whole ecosystem if left unchecked. Due to Nakarkos having huge appetites, they can easily wipe out all life in surrounding areas. Nakarkos have even been reported shooting down airships for food. Though Nakarkos can destroy an ecosystem, it doesn't actually want to do that. It prefers to leave its nest in search of prey so, it still have plenty of food at the environment it is living within. If the adventurer's Guild finds a Nakarkos' lair, they will immediately send adventurer to repel it before it can bring further damage to that ecosystem. However, it is said that Nakarkos will eventually return to said area in order to feed themselves further.

Nakarkos is able to produce an eerie, blue mucus from its body. This mucus is sticky, allowing it to capture prey and even shoot prey items out of the air. Though this mucus is used for capturing prey, Nakarkos has another use for the mucus. This mucus is used to help prevent bones from corroding, sticking bones together, and to prevent the bones from collapsing. With this mucus, it can make a protective bone armor to protect its whole body from attacks and even use some bones as weapons. Like a cuttlefish, it has sticky tentacles used to drag prey back to its lair. These tentacles are usually covered in bones for protection, ending with a huge skull. But this isn't just limited to skulls. Nakarkos has been seen using various monster parts to attack foes or to kill prey with. Some of these parts are hard to identify due to Nakarkos altering their shapes in order for it to use them. Some parts that it has been seen using is a fused together Glavenus jaw and tail, a {@creature Lagiacrus|MHMM}'s shell shockers, a Brachydios's pounders, and a Uragaan's chin.

These various parts give the appearance that it has "two heads" but Nakarkos's true head is hidden away underground most of the time. When it feels its life is truly in danger, it will eventually reveal its true face. Its true face is cephalopod-like, resembling a cuttlefish. By revealing its face, it can use its bone-crunching beak. So to make it easier for itself to use the Fire Beam, it will fire the element from its tentacles and build it up in its mouth before firing a massive beam. To move quickly, Nakarkos has jet propulsion like squids. It uses this to return to its nest at a quicker rate, so it can avoid getting eaten itself.

items.name: Nakarkos Hide
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Nakarkos Arm Brace
entries: {@i Adrenaline.} The first time you drop below half of your hit point maximum in combat, you gain a rush of adrenaline. On your next turn your movement speed doubles and you can take one extra action.

items.name: Nakarkos Cuttlebone
entries: {@i Survivor+.} When an ally, that you can see, is reduced to 0 hit points you can use your reaction to gain +2 AC, +2 damage, and +2 to attack rolls for 1 minute. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Nakarkos Soul Orb
entries: {@i (Sorcerer, Warlock, and Wizard only)} This armor has two runes that it regains daily at dawn. As an action you can expend one of these runes to cast {@spell armor of agathys} at 5th level. When the spell deals its damage, it deals it as piercing damage instead of as cold damage.

items.name: Nakarkos Hide
entries: {@i Elderseal.} Существо, пораженное этим оружием, не может использовать действие, которое имеет перезарядку, до начала вашего следующего хода. Существо все еще может бросить бросок на перезарядку своей способности в конце своего хода.

items.name: S.Dalamadur Gazer
entries: {@i (Ranged weapon only) Bonus Shot.} Когда вы совершаете действие атаки, вы можете совершить одну дополнительную атаку этим оружием в качестве бонусного действия.

items.name: Nakarkos Arm Brace
entries: {@i Furor.} When you are below one-tenth of your maximum hit points, your melee weapon attacks with this weapon deal maximum damage.

items.name: Radiant Mucus
entries: While holding this weapon, you can use your bonus action to transform the weapon into a {@item tentacle rod|DMG} (DMG 208) or back to its original form. Each tentacle on the rod has a different damage type: tentacle one, fire; tentacle two, lightning; tentacle three, bludgeoning.

items.name: Nakarkos Cuttlebone
entries: {@i Crisis+.} While suffering from an abnormal status effect, such as {@condition poisoned}, burning, slowed, {@condition blinded}, etc, all attacks and spells deal an extra 1d12 spell or weapon damage.

items.name: Nakarkos Fang
entries: {@i Trump Card.} You have advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are {@condition grappled}.

items.name: Nakarkos Soul Orb
entries: {@i Amplify.} The elemental damage done by your weapon is increased by one die size and the duration of consumables is increased by 50%.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Намиэль может дышать воздухом и водой.

trait.name: Flooded
entries: Any space that has been flooded by one of namielle's actions is filled with two to three feet of water, and it is difficult terrain for any creature without a innate or magical swimming speed. The flooded areas remain flooded for 24 hours, until the namielle absorbs the water, or until it is turned to steam.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The namielle's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 18}), requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The namielle makes two attacks: one attack with its bite and one with its claw, or it makes two attacks with its water globule.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, Reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, Reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Water Globule
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, or become affected with {@disease waterblight|MHMM} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a hit or miss, the 5 foot area below the target is flooded.

action.name: Tidal Wave
entries: The namielle conjures up a wave of water that crashes down on an area in front of it. The area can be up to 30 feet long, up to 10 feet wide, and up to 10 feet tall. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one. The water then spreads out 15 feet across the ground in all directions, flooding the area.

action.name: Maelstrom
entries: The water in a 30-foot radius around the namielle is pulled towards it and absorbed into its body, increasing its AC by 2 until the end of its next turn. Each creature in flooded terrain must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and be pulled 10 feet toward the namielle on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one and is not pulled.

action.name: Electric Divebomb {@recharge 5}
entries: The namielle releases a torrent of water from its body, flooding the ground in a 30-foot radius around it. It then rises into the sky while gathering electricity and comes crashing down at its same location causing a massive eruption of water and a shockwave of steam. Each creature within 30 feet of the namielle must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If the creature is within 10 feet of the namielle, it takes an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) lightning damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Намиэль делает одну атаку своим укусом или водяной глобулой.

legendary.name: Water Beam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The namielle exhales a torrent of water in an 60-foot cone, flooding the area. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold damage and be affected with {@disease waterblight|MHMM} on a failed save, or half as much damage and not affected with {@disease waterblight|MHMM} on a successful one. The water then spreads out 15 feet across the ground in all directions, flooding the area.

legendary.name: Electric Current (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The namielle touches the tip of its wing to a flooded space within 10 feet of it, sending an electric current coursing through it. This current travels through each connected flooded space causing an explosion of steam in each space as it travels through them. Each creature in those spaces must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Spaces affected by this ability then lose the flooded status.

Намиэль - это Старший дракон, в котором есть черты ската манта, глубоководной рыбы и медузы. Его массивные крылья окрашены в черный цвет сверху и светло-голубой снизу, с радужным свечением, которое постоянно пульсирует. Голова красного и синего цвета с таким же пульсирующим свечением, но когда из нее выливается вода и она высыхает, то приобретает молочно-русый цвет, который распространяется как на тело, так и на нижнюю часть крыльев. На нижней челюсти у него также имеются многочисленные длинные усики.

Как и большинство Старших драконов, большинство монстров бегут от одного его присутствия. Он утверждает себя как вершина пищевой цепи. Однако что он потребляет, остается загадкой. Судя по игольчатой структуре зубов, можно предположить, что он питается рыбой и, возможно, вивернами. Только другие Старшие драконы и недавно обнаруженная {@creature Savage Deviljho|MHMM}, с которой по силе может сравниться Грубая виверна, похоже, готовы бросить ей вызов.

Намиэль - очень уникальный Старший дракон, его тело напоминает различных существ, обитающих в океане. Его крылья напоминают крылья ската манта, а кончики могут разряжаться электричеством, как у электрического угря. Мембрана крыльев и часть морды светятся биолюминесцентным светом, пульсирующим всеми цветами радуги, и у него большие иглообразные зубы, как у глубоководных рыб. На крыльях есть гребни, как у гребневика, которые придают ему дополнительную биолюминесценцию. Однако самой примечательной его особенностью является способность производить, контролировать и поглощать воду.

Однако эта вода не кажется чистой водой, а представляет собой смесь внутренней слюны и воды, смешанных вместе, чтобы создать слизь, похожую на воду, которая прилипает и остается влажной в течение длительных периодов времени. Эта вода вытекает из его рта и может свободно впитываться обратно, а взмахом крыльев или передних когтей он может заставить охотников, стоящих на этой воде, скользить вперед и назад по своему желанию. Она также может выстрелить этой водой в землю, вызывая приливную волну. Еще интереснее то, что Намиэль может вырабатывать электричество и использовать молнию для того, чтобы ее водяные пятна электризовались, а затем взрывались, превращаясь в пар.

Уникальность Намиеля заключается в том, что он может летать, даже едва хлопая крыльями, и скользить по воздуху, как скат манта в воде. Намиэль также обладает способностью затмевать солнце своим телом, что приводит к мгновенной темноте. Однако следует отметить, что эта способность была продемонстрирована только при первой находке.

items.name: Namielle Finehide
entries: {@i Tool Specialist.} Во время ношения этих доспехов ваш бонус к мастерству удваивается при любой проверке способностей, сделанной с помощью инструмента, которым вы владеете.

items.name: Namielle Hardclaw
entries: {@i Blightproof.} Во время ношения этой брони вы невосприимчивы к заклинаниям ослепления, заклинаниям, подобным способностям, и условиям.

items.name: Namielle Whisker
entries: {@i Constitution.} Время действия замедляющих эффектов, таких как заклинание {@spell slow} или атака дыханием медного дракона, уменьшается наполовину, пока вы носите эту броню.

items.name: Namielle Fellwing
entries: {@i Stamina Surge+2.} Пока вы носите эти доспехи, вы можете использовать действие, чтобы произнести заклинание {@spell haste} с них один раз в день, но можете выбрать целью только себя, когда вы это делаете, и вы получаете 1 уровень {@condition exhaustion}, когда заклинание заканчивается.

items.name: Namielle Lash
entries: While wearing this armor you have resistances to lightning damage.

items.name: Namielle Mantle
entries: While wearing this armor you have immunity to cold damage.

items.name: Namielle Finehide
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to cast the {@spell levitate} spell on yourself at will.

items.name: Namielle Hardclaw
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon you can use a bonus action to cast the {@spell dancing lights} spell at will.

items.name: Namielle Whisker
entries: Когда вы наносите критическое попадание этим оружием, цель не может использовать реакцию до начала своего следующего хода.

items.name: Namielle Fellwing
entries: When you finish a short or long rest you choose a damage type. This damage type can be either cold or lightning damage. A creature hit by this weapon takes an extra 1d8 of the chosen damage type.

items.name: Namielle Lash
entries: {@i (spellcaster only)} This weapon has 10 runes. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell shape water|XGE} (1 rune), {@spell create or destroy water} (1 rune), {@spell fog cloud} (1 rune), {@spell call lightning} (3 runes) or {@spell control water} (4 runes). The weapon regains 1d6 + 4 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the last rune it cannot regain any runes for one week.

items.name: Namielle Mantle
entries: You gain a + 1 bonus to your spell attack rolls and spell save DC while attuned to this weapon. This bonus increases to +2 when the spell you are casting deals cold or lightning damage.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Материал для улучшения оружия любой раритетности.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Материал для улучшения брони любой редкости.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or Darkness, the Nargacuga can take the {@action Hide} action as a Bonus Action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +11.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Nargacuga makes three attacks. one with its bite, one with its bladed wings, and one with its tail swipe. Or it makes two tail spike attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bladed Wings
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tail Spikes
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Feral Pounce (recharge 5-6).
entries: The Nargacuga leaps towards its target, jumping 10 feet, as part of its movement, and attacks with both its claws. The target must succeed a {@dc 18} Dex saving throw or take 44 ({@dice 8d10}) damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a success the target takes half damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}. Additionally, if the target is {@condition prone} or knocked {@condition prone}, the nargacuga can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

У него черная чешуя, черный мех и кошмарные красные глаза, придающие ему вид и стиль хищной черной пантеры. Его темный, дикий вид позволяет предположить, что он может быть в основном ночным хищником. Когда она разъярена, ее глаза светятся ярко-красным светом, а при движении Наргакуга оставляет за собой след из красноватых линий. Наргакуга способна атаковать почти всеми частями своего тела, в основном крыльями с лезвиями и шипастым хвостом. Хвост поднимает большие шипы, которые можно отбрасывать и соединять с атаками для нанесения сокрушительных ударов. Позвонки и мышцы хвоста очень гибкие, что делает хвост наргакуги еще и гибким. Хвост также является его самым мощным оружием. Чешуйки на конце хвоста можно также встряхивать, чтобы издавать дребезжащие звуки, похожие на звуки змеи-гремучки.

Наргакуга - осторожный и осмотрительный монстр. Ему очень легко подкрасться к охотнику. Наргакуга живет в темных местах, к которым она приспособилась. Она отдыхает на высоких деревьях, до которых трудно или невозможно дотянуться, поэтому охотники не могут застать ее врасплох и схватить. Наргакуга просыпается, когда охотники оказываются прямо перед деревом, благодаря своим природным органам чувств.
Наргакуга обычно и в основном обитает в больших лесах. Хотя иногда наргакугу можно встретить на болотах, в джунглях и, очень редко, в горных массивах или на равнинах.

items.name: Nargacuga Scale
entries: While in dim light or darkness, you can take the {@action hide} action as a bonus action.

items.name: Nargacuga Pelt
entries: While you wear this armor, your eye's glow red at night, much like the nargacuga's. You gain {@sense darkvision} out to 60 feet. if you already have darkvision, it is increased by an additional 60 feet.

items.name: Nargacuga Razor
entries: While you wear this armor, being in a lightly obscured area doesn't impose disadvantage on your Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks if you can both see and hear.

items.name: Narga Medulla
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Nargacuga Tail
entries: While you wear this armor, your walking speed becomes 30 feet, unless your walking speed is higher, and your speed isn't reduced if you are encumbered or wearing heavy armor. In addition, you can jump three times the normal distance, though you can't jump farther than your remaining movement would allow.

items.name: Nargacuga Tailspike
entries: {@i Evade Window.} Эта броня имеет 3 руны, и ежедневно на рассвете она восстанавливает 1d3 израсходованных рун. Когда вы проваливаете бросок на ловкость, когда носите эти доспехи, вы можете использовать свою реакцию, чтобы потратить 1 руну на успех броска на ловкость.

items.name: Nargacuga Scale
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d6 slashing damage.

items.name: Nargacuga Fang
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, your ammo pouch can hold double the amount of {@item pierce ammo (20)|AGMH|pierce ammo} and {@item cluster ammo (1)|AGMH|cluster ammo} it can normally hold.

items.name: Nargacuga Razor
entries: {@i Abnormal Status Atk up (M).} Whenever you inflict a condition on a creature or object that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, the maximum duration of the condition is increased by 12 seconds.

items.name: Narga Medulla
entries: {@i Quick Load.} You can reload as a free action while you are attuned to this weapon.

items.name: Nargacuga Tail
entries: {@i Status Pursuit+.} You have advantage on opportunity attacks and creatures within your reach provoke opportunity attacks even if they took the {@action Disengage} action, if the creature is afflicted with a Condition.

items.name: Nargacuga Tailspike
entries: {@i Critical Eye.} Дальность критического удара ваших атак оружием увеличивается на 1.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the nergigante fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nergigante has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spiked Regrowth
entries: The nergigante has spikes covering its body, granting it +2 AC. These spikes regrow at the start of the nergigante's turn if they are lost. After using an action or legendary action, the nergigante can use its spiked explosion as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nergigante can use its frightful presence. It then makes four attacks. one with its bite, one with its horn, and two with its claws.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the nergigante's choice that is within 120 feet of the nergigante and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the nergigante's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Wing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Meteor Crash {@recharge 5}
entries: The nergigante leaps into the air using its wings to hover briefly and comes crashing down in a 15-foot square area within 60 feet of it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 59 ({@damage 17d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spiked Explosion
entries: The spikes on the nergigante explode outward, removing the AC bonus it receives spiked regrowth and strikes all targets within 30-foot sphere of it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Dragon Eater
entries: The nergigante feeds on the corpse of a dragon. A large or smaller dragon is consumed whole, while the nergigante can feed on a Huge or bigger dragon for up to 30 seconds. For each round the Nergigante feeds on a dragon, it heals for an amount equal to the dragons Challenge rating.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The nergigante moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Wing Attack
entries: The nergigante makes a wing attack.

legendary.name: Trample (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The nergigante moves up to its speed, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking attacks of opportunity. Any creatures the nergigante moves through must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

Like most other Elder Dragons, Nergigante possesses six limbs; four legs and two wings. On its head are two large horns resembling a bull. Though it is classified as an Elder Dragon, the Nergigante isn't known to cause any natural disasters, but its sudden appearance is enough to scare off other species, which can cause them to invade other areas.

Covering Nergigante's head, arms, tail, and wings are small spikes that break easily with enough damage. These spikes are believed to be made of a material similar to enamel and can break in a number of ways, though they mostly break from the sheer force of Nergigante's attacks. Unlike other Elder Dragons that use elemental abilities to survive, Nergigante uses brute strength to take on its prey.

Nergigante also has extreme regenerative abilities that allow it to regrow lost spikes, up to 1800 of them, in mere seconds. Researchers theorize that this regenerative process starts when its spikes have taken a certain amount of damage, and it is said that it can regrow them an infinite number of times. It also seems to have the ability to sense highly pure bioenergy.

Nergigante doesn't have a gender and reproduces asexually. It needs large quantities of bioenergy to propagate, but the way it does so is bizarre compared to other species. When Nergigante regenerates its spikes, some of them may gain the bioenergy it has used and begin to produce germ cells, allowing Nergigante to produce another of its kind without the need of a mate. Since Nergigante needs more bioenergy than usual to produce the next generation, it needs to find a food source with incredible strength. Interestingly, the offspring are genetically identical to their parent.

items.name: Nergigante Regrowth Plate
entries: Во время ношения этой брони вы восстанавливаете 1d6 хит-пойнтов каждые 10 минут, если у вас есть хотя бы 1 хит-пойнт. Если вы потеряете часть тела, доспех заставит недостающую часть отрасти и вернуться к полной функциональности через 1d6 + 1 день, если у вас есть хотя бы 1 хит-пойнт все это время.

items.name: Nergigante Carapace
entries: {@i Stamina Surge+3.} Пока вы носите эти доспехи, вы можете использовать действие, чтобы произнести заклинание {@spell haste} с них один раз в день, но при этом вы можете выбрать целью только себя.

items.name: Nergigante Talon
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal {@damage 2d4} piercing damage to them. This damage bypasses resistance and immunity, and can't be reduced or avoided by any means.

items.name: Nergigante Tail
entries: Пока вы носите эту броню, любое критическое попадание по вам становится обычным попаданием.

items.name: Immortal Dragonscale
entries: You have resistance to fire and cold damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Nergigante Gem
entries: While wearing this armor, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and spell attacks have disadvantage against you.

items.name: Nergigante Regrowth Plate
entries: {@i Maximum Might.} While your hit points are full and you are not suffering from any levels of {@condition exhaustion}, you deal maximum weapon damage with your attacks.

items.name: Nergigante Carapace
entries: {@i (Bow only)} As a bonus action you can grow a black spike from the palm of your hand and nock it to your bow. A creature hit by this spike suffers normal weapon damage and the spike lodges itself into the creature. A creature's speed is reduced by 5 feet for every spike impaled into it. If the target or a creature within 5 feet of it uses an action to pull out the spikes, or if some other effect removes them, the creature's movement speed returns to normal.
You are able to grow up to 10 black spikes. You are unable to grow anymore until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Nergigante Talon
entries: Ваше оружие наносит дополнительные 1d10 косых повреждений.

items.name: Nergigante Tail
entries: When you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, that target takes an extra {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage, provided that the target isn't a construct or an Undead. You gain temporary hit points equal to the extra damage dealt.

items.name: Immortal Dragonscale
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 2d6 piercing damage.

items.name: Nergigante Gem
entries: The first time you attack with this weapon on each of your turns, you can transfer some or all of the weapon's bonus to your armor class, instead of using the bonus on any attacks that turn. For example you could reduce the bonus to your attack and damage rolls by 2 to gain a +2 bonus to AC. The adjusted bonuses remain in effect until the start of your next turn, although you must hold the weapon to gain a bonus to AC from it.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Материал для улучшения оружия любой раритетности.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Материал для улучшения брони любой редкости.

trait.name: Reel In
entries: As a bonus action, the nerscylla can pull a webbed target up to 15 feet towards it. If the webbed creature is pulled within 5 feet of the nerscylla, it can make a stinger attack against it.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The nerscylla can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The nerscylla's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the nersyclla knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Swing
entries: As a bonus action the nerscylla can fire a string of webbing as thick as a rope towards an object or terrain that is above it and is within 60 feet of it. It can then use the webbing to pull itself up to 30 feet in the direction of the object or terrain.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The nerscylla ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nerscylla makes three attack, one with its poisonous maw and two with its claws.

action.name: Poisonous Maw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage, plus 13 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage. On hit, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

action.name: Stinger
entries: The nerscylla impales a webbed creature within 5 feet of it with its stinger. That creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 hour, or until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to shake it awake.

If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Webbing Shot {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The creature is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} creature can make a {@dc 15} Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The creature is no longer {@condition restrained} if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 12, 10 hit points, resistance to bludgeoning damage, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

Nerscylla physically resembles a real life Arachnid, but is much larger in size. Nerscylla is armed with four powerful legs and two claws, each one tipped with a formidable barbed hook, used for holding prey as well as keeping its grip while scaling walls. In addition, it possesses a massive pair of retractable jaws which can inflict a poisonous bite. It can produce a strong, sticky webbing that it uses to trap prey and build nests. Its long, strong legs allow it to move at fast speeds, even sideways. At the tip of its abdomen is a large stinger it may use to attack. Sharp, poisonous spikes protrude from its back.

These large Temnocerans are ambush predators that will readily attack from behind, below, and above. When making a web they'll wisely construct it in an area where potential prey is most likely to appear. They are most commonly seen to construct their webs near farming settlements where they will attack and kill any livestock that wander into the vicinity of their web for food. Occasionally, they will even snatch away any unwary villagers/farmers that wander into their territory. As stated earlier {@creature Gypceros|MHMM} are the favorite prey of the Nerscylla but the food isn't the only reason why the Bird Wyvern is targeted. When killing a Gypceros the large arachnid not only eats it but disturbingly rips the skin off the avian Wyvern's body and wears it's skin as a cloak. This shocking behavior is both horrifying and intriguing to naturalists. The reason why Nerscylla do this is to increase their strength, use as camouflage, and for protection.

items.name: Rubbery Hide
entries: While you are wearing this armor, you can use your reaction or bonus action to gain resistance to lightning damage until the end of your next turn. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Nerscylla Shell
entries: {@i Perceptive.} You are proficient with {@i Perception} checks while wearing this armor.

items.name: Nerscylla Chelicera
entries: {@i Trap Master.} While you wear this armor, you can set {@item pitfall trap|AGMH}s or {@item shock trap|AGMH}s as a bonus action and you can use an action to cast the {@spell snare|XGE} spell from it. Once used, the snare effect can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: N.Sleep Sac
entries: {@i Negate Sleep.} You cannot unwillingly be put to sleep by any means while wearing this armor.

items.name: Nerscylla Claw
entries: {@i Spider Climb.} While you wear this armor, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. However, the armor doesn't allow you to move this way on a slippery surface, such as one covered by ice or oil.

items.name: Nerscylla Spike
entries: You have resistance to poison damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Rubbery Hide
entries: While holding your weapon, you can speak a command word and transform it into a fishing pole with a hook, a line, and a reel. Speaking the command word again changes the fishing pole back into the weapon.

items.name: Nerscylla Chelicera
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon they must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

items.name: Drone Substance
entries: {@i Capture Novice.} While attuned to this weapon {@item tranq bomb|AGMH}s and {@item tranq ammo (1)|AGMH|tranq ammo} roll an extra 2d8 when they hit a creature.

items.name: N.Sleep Sac
entries: When you {@condition poisoned|PHB|poison} a creature and they fail the saving throw by 5 or more, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} until they take damage, are shaken awake, or the poison is removed.

items.name: Nerscylla Claw
entries: When you cast a spell that deals poison damage, you gain a +1 bonus to its spell attack roll.

items.name: Nerscylla Spike
entries: When you hit a creature or object that is within 60 feet of you with a ranged weapon attack, you can use your bonus action to pull the target 10 feet towards you.

items.name: Drone Substance
entries: This oily like substance can be applied to the skin of a medium or smaller creature. Applying the substance takes 1 minute. The affected creature then has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks for 1 hour. During this time if they attempt to charm a creature with spells or spell like abilities, the targeted creature has disadvantage on its saving throw.
{@i Cursed.} When applied to a creature, there is a 10% chance to attract nearby {@creature seltas|MHMM} while in urban areas. While in the wilds, there is a 50% chance to attract nearby seltas.

items.name: Monster Fluid
entries: Необычный или редкий материал для модернизации, который можно использовать для изготовления оружия или доспехов.

items.name: N.Sleep Sac
entries: A Material that replaces the {@table plants|AGMH|sleep herb} when crafting {@item tranq bomb|AGMH}s or {@item tranq ammo (1)|AGMH|tranq ammo}.

trait.name: Desert Camouflage
entries: The nibelsnarf has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in desert terrain while burrowed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nibelsnarf makes three bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Wind Tunnel {@recharge 5}
entries: The nibelsnarf exhales sand and debris swallowed in a 30-foot cone, each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

reaction.name: Sand Cloud
entries: When a creature makes an attack against the nibelsnarf, it can use its reaction to expel a large sand cloud from the gills on the back of its head. Any creature within 5 feet of the nibelsnarf and flanking it must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If a creature fails the save by more than 5 they are also pushed 10 feet away from the nibelsnarf.

Leviathans that have adapted to live in sandy areas. They burrow through sand and locate prey aurally, then suck both the target and any surrounding sand into their maws. It has the remarkable ability to swim in sand, shared only with a few monsters, and its streamlined body helps it move through it at great speeds. They are capable of burrowing into the sand and of disguising themselves as sand dunes to ambush prey.

It has a huge mouth for eating its prey such as {@creature Rhenoplos|MHMM} in one bite, like the {@creature Gobul|MHMM}. It locates its prey with hearing. It shares this trait with the {@creature Agnaktor|MHMM}, which is also a land dwelling Leviathan. It is possible that the two developed this ability because they spend most of their time underground. It spits sand at predators that try to attack it. Its eyes are on top of its head, so it can see its prey easier when lurking in the sand; however, their placement also makes it difficult for it to see anything directly in front of it. They also have salamander-like "gills" which it uses to filter out sand and absorb minerals in the sand. It uses this clearing of the sand as an attack, as the sand shoots from the gills at a high enough speed to hurt individuals caught in the blast. Niblesnarf seem to have very strong stomachs, capable of withstanding a bomb exploding in it. Inside the massive mouth of this predator is an enlarged uvula that stores nutrients. This organ is essential to the leviathan's survival within the arid Sandy Plains.

items.name: Nibelsnarf Hide
entries: {@i Gourmand.} While attuned to this armor, you double the amount of days you can go without food or water before suffering a level of {@condition exhaustion}.

items.name: Nibel Carapace
entries: {@i Speed Eating.} Пока вы настроены на эту броню, вы можете использовать любой расходный материал, такой как зелье или пища, в качестве бонусного действия; пока вы являетесь тем, кто его потребляет.

items.name: Brilliant Fluid
entries: While you wear this armor, you can use a bonus action to exhale sand and debris in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
После использования это свойство нельзя использовать снова, пока вы не закончите длительный отдых.

items.name: Nibelsnarf Scalp
entries: While you wear this armor, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in desert terrain.

items.name: Nibelsnarf Claw
entries: {@i (Ranged weapon only) Pellet Shot.} When you roll a 15 or higher on your attack roll with this weapon while using normal ammo, you can make an attack against an additional creature within 5 feet of your original target.

items.name: Brilliant Fluid
entries: {@i (Druid, Sorcerer, & Wizard only)} While attuned to this weapon you can cast the {@spell Earth Tremor|XGE} and the {@spell Dust Devil|XGE} spell at 2nd level once per day, without expending a spell slot.

items.name: Nibelsnarf Scalp
entries: {@i (Melee Weapon only)} When you hit a creature with this weapon, they must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition blinded} until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Blind Panic
entries: If the paolumu is {@condition blinded} while flying, it immediately falls to the ground and is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The paolumu makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage or 20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage while enlarged.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage or 17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Deep Breath
entries: The paolumu takes a deep breath, pulling all creatures and objects within a 60-foot radius of it 20 feet towards it. An unwilling creature that can see the paolumu can make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is not pulled towards the paolumu. A creature or object behind cover, automatically succeeds on the saving throw.

Additionally, all sleep clouds within range are inhaled by the paolumu. These clouds travel across the ground until directly below the paolumu before vanishing. If a sleep cloud passes through a creatures space, they must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, at disadvantage if more than one cloud passes through their space. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn. If they fail the save by 5 or more, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} until the creature takes damage, or until someone uses an action to shake or slap the creature awake.

action.name: Dive Bomb
entries: If the paolumu is flying, and dives at least 10 feet straight toward a target it can then use this action to slam its body in a space that contains one or more creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice), or take 31 ({@damage 7d8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the paolumu's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the paolumu's space.

action.name: Sleep Cloud
entries: The paolumu exhales a narcotic gas at a location within 60 feet of it. This pale blue-green gas fills a 5-foot radius sphere centered on that location for 10 minutes or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

A creature that starts its turn in this gas or enters it for the first time on its turn must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of their next turn. If they fail the save by 5 or more, the creature falls {@condition unconscious} until the creature takes damage, or until someone uses an action to shake or slap the creature awake.

action.name: Sleep Gas (1/day)
entries: The paolumu fills its lungs with as much air as possible and releases a torrent of sleep gas in a 30-foot radius around it. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. A creature may repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success. If the creature fails the throw by 5 or more, they fall {@condition unconscious} until someone until the  creature takes damage, or until someone uses an action to shake or slap the creature awake.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The paolumu makes one attack with its tail.

legendary.name: Breathe
entries: The paolumu moves up to two sleep clouds 10 feet away from it or 10 feet towards it.

legendary.name: Enlarge
entries: For 1 minute or until the paolumu uses its sleep cloud or sleep gas, the paolumu magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the paolumu is Huge, it can hover, roll one additional weapon damage die on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the paolumu lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

legendary.name: Sleep (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The paolumu uses its sleep cloud.

The Nightshade Paolumu body is covered in soft fur that is primarily black or dark purple, contrasting with its standard counterpart's white-and-pink coloration. Its tail is also darkly colored, matching the color of its fur. Its face is pale white, while on its neck are two brightly colored patches resembling the patterns on the tail feathers of a peacock. When it is deflated, these patches are more difficult to see. Its wings contain faint hints of green on the webbing.

Nightshade Paolumu is far more aggressive and proficient in aerial combat than {@creature Paolumu|MHMM}. Whereas Paolumu requires several attempts to suck enough air into its throat sac to get airborne, Nightshade Paolumu is able to inflate itself with a single inhalation. Once airborne, it is capable of flying at high speeds and in unpredictable patterns by releasing its stored air, often dealing damage to hunters that are hit.

Its most distinctive ability is a pale blue-green gas it expels from its mouth while inflated, which acts as a powerful narcotic that puts to sleep hunters that are exposed. It's able to produce small clouds or exhale a single, massive cloud, which remain on the battlefield for a short duration. It can inhale without inflating itself in order to draw in patches of its gas, and it can spread them out using the wind currents it stirs up with its tail.

items.name: Nightshade Paolumu Thickfur
entries: While in dim light or darkness, you can take the {@action hide} action as a bonus action.

items.name: Nightshade Paolumu Shard
entries: Пока вы носите эту броню, у вас есть бонус +3 к {@skill Acrobatics} проверкам.

items.name: Torpor Sac
entries: Whenever you make a saving throw against the {@condition unconscious} condition or other sleep-like effects, you do so with advantage.

items.name: Paolumu Cortex
entries: You have resistance to thunder damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Nightshade Paolumu Fellwing
entries: {@i Wide-Range.} Когда вы используете {@table plants|AGMH|Herbs}, {@item Antidote|AGMH}с, {@item Cool Drink|AGMH}с, {@item Hot Drink|AGMH}с, {@table plants|AGMH|Adamant Seeds, or Might Seeds}, все другие существа в радиусе 10 футов от вас получают его эффект.

items.name: Nightshade Gem
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|PHB|enlarge} spell from it. You can use this property twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Nightshade Paolumu Thickfur
entries: You can read books you are touching while sleeping.

items.name: Nightshade Paolumu Shard
entries: Ваше оружие наносит дополнительные 1d6 единиц поражающего урона.

items.name: Torpor Sac
entries: {@i {Spellcaster only)} You know the {@spell sleep} spell while you wear this armor. If you prepare spells, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If this spell is not on your class list, the spell is nonetheless a class spell for you.

items.name: Paolumu Cortex
entries: This weapon warns you of danger. While the weapon is on your person, it magically awakens you and your companions within a 30-foot range if any of you are sleeping naturally when combat begins.

items.name: Nightshade Paolumu Fellwing
entries: {@i Weakness Exploit.} When you have advantage on an attack roll with this weapon and you hit the target, you can have your weapon deal its maximum damage if the lower of the two d20 rolls would also hit the target (all extra damage dice must still be rolled). You can use this property a number of times equal to your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice), regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Nightshade Gem
entries: {@i Maximum Might.} While your hit points are full and you are not suffering from any levels of {@condition exhaustion}, you deal maximum weapon damage with your attacks.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: The nitrotoad explodes when it drops to 0 hit points. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and be thrown 10 feet in a random direction away from the nitrotoad on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't thrown on a successful one.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The nitrotoad's long jump is up to 10 feet and its high jump is up to 5 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} попадание, радиус действия 5 футов, одна цель. {@h}1 колющее повреждение.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When the odogaron reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the odogaron can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a claw attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The odogaron makes three attacks; one bite attack and two claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or lose 5 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to an bloody wound. Each time the odogaron hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 ({@dice 1d6}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: The odogaron halves the damage that it takes from an attack that hits it. The odogaron must be able to see the attacker.

Odogaron resembles a gruesome feral dog. It is covered in red scales and bony protrusions that resemble muscle tissue and bone. Its tail is particularly bony and can be used as a club. The monster has piercing blue eyes. Odogaron's most distinctive feature is its double row of claws, which it uses to inflict deep wounds in its prey, causing them to bleed to death.

Despite its size, Odogaron is quite an agile monster. It is able to rush down prey before delivering bites with its powerful jaws. Odogaron makes its home in the Underdark, where it can be seen dragging back the carcasses of its prey. However, it will venture up to the surface above in search of prey, where it assumes an apex role in the food chain alongside {@creature Legiana|MHMM}.

Odogaron is a hostile monster that will attack anything that it encounters on sight, no matter how big a prey item is. This monster is even willing to attack {@creature Vaal Hazak|MHMM} an elder dragon despite essentially confronting a primordial force.

items.name: Odogaron Sinew
entries: You have a +2 bonus to {@skill Intimidation} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Odogaron Scale
entries: Пока вы носите эти доспехи, вы можете использовать свою реакцию или бонусное действие, чтобы получить сопротивление некротическому урону до конца вашего следующего хода. Вы можете использовать это свойство дважды, восстанавливая его после длительного отдыха.

items.name: Odogaron Claw
entries: {@i Marathon Sprinter.} While wearing this armor, you can take the {@action dash} action as a bonus action. You can use this property a number of times equal to your Dexterity modifier, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Odogaron Plate
entries: {@i Negate Bleeding.} You are immune to wounding effects, such as the {@creature Odogaron|MHMM}'s bloody wound or the {@creature bearded devil}'s infernal wound while you wear this armor.

items.name: Odogaron Sinew
entries: {@i Quick Sheath.} Пока вы настроены на это оружие, вы можете всегда носить его в ножнах как свободное действие, даже если вы уже достали оружие как часть вашего действия перемещения.

items.name: Odogaron Claw
entries: Ваше оружие наносит дополнительные 1d4 косых повреждений.

items.name: Odogaron Tail
entries: {@i (Light Bowgun only)} When you hit a target with your {@item demon ammo (1)|AGMH|demon ammo}, its effect is doubled.

items.name: Odogaron Fang
entries: {@i Critical Eye.} Дальность критического удара ваших атак оружием увеличивается на 1.

items.name: Odogaron Gem
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can wound the target. At the start of each of the wounded creature's turns, it takes {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage for each time you've wounded it, and it can then make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, ending the effect of all such wounds on itself on a success.
