Alternatively, the wounded creature, or a creature within 5 feet of it, can use an action to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check, ending the effect of such wounds on it on a success.

items.name: Nourishing Extract
entries: A material that replaces the {@item catalyst|AGMH} for crafting {@item demondrug|AGMH} or {@item armorskin|AGMH} potions. It can also be used in place of {@item mega nutrients|AGMH} when crafting {@item max potion|AGMH}s or {@item ancient potion|AGMH}s.

items.name: Odogaron Scale
entries: A material that when combined with a {@item vial|PHB} creates {@item Oil of Sharpness|DMG} ({@dc 15} {@item Alchemist's Supplies|PHB}).

monster.name: Palamute
languages: understands Common but can't speak it

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The palamute has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Canine Mount
entries: A Medium or smaller humanoid creature can ride on the palamute's back if it allows it. In such a situation, the palamute acts as a controlled mount. While on it, the rider can use its bonus action to use the palamute's trackers trait.

trait.name: Scent (Recharges on a long rest)
entries: When the palamute finds the sign of a creature, it can spend 1 minute memorizing that creature's scent. For the next 24 hours, the palamute has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track the creature.

trait.name: Tracker
entries: As a bonus action, the palamute can move up to its speed towards the creature it has the scent of, or if it is following its scent trail.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The palamute makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} попадание, радиус действия 5 футов, одна цель. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) колющего урона.

action.name: Maul (Recharges on a short or long rest)
entries: The palamute leaps onto a Large or bigger creature's face and makes one bite attack against it. On a hit, the creature is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. On a hit or miss, the palamute remains on the creature and has advantage on melee attack rolls while it remains on it.

At the start of the palamute's turn, it must make an contested Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against the creature's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. On a failed check, the palamute is thrown off the creature and lands in a space adjacent to it. If the palamute fails the check by 5 or more, it lands {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Palamute Sidekick
entries: As of right now, the palamute stat block has been built with the idea of using it as a sidekick using {@book Tasha's Cauldron for Everything rules (p.142)|tce,4,sidekicks}.

Since many of the rules on armor and weapon proficiencies require the creature to be humanoid. We will instead just ignore that rule and the palamutes gain the same proficiencies as if they were humanoid, except for ranged weapons, palamutes can't use those (thrown weapons are ok).

So what do we do about costs for gear and rarity? Well for the sake of it all until I get around to making proper sidekick classes for palamutes and palicos. You can use the standard {@item barding|PHB} rules found in the DMG for cost of armor (4x normal amount I believe), or allow them to be bought for normal cost since palamutes and palicos are pretty common in monster hunter. It is up to your DM.

Rarity doesn't necessarily matter for this gear as I don't plan on letting the palamutes or palicos gain weapon properties from rarities. Instead I'll eventually make more of their abilities into uses based on armor or weapon rarity I believe.

{@b For now I am considering allowing 1 armor and 1 weapon material allowed in the palamutes and palico's gear}, but this is a test and I am not really sure how good or bad this may be. It is up to your DM if they choose to allow it also.

trait.name: Blind Panic
entries: If the paolumu is flying and becomes {@condition blinded}. It panics, ending its enlarge and falls {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The paolumu makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, or 20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage while enlarged.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage, or 17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the paolumu magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the paolumu is Huge, it can hover, roll one additional weapon damage die on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the paolumu lacks the room to become Huge, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: Dive Bomb
entries: If the paolumu is flying, enlarged and dives at least 10 feet straight toward a target it can then use this action to slam its body in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 31 ({@damage 7d8}) bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the paolumu's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the paolumu's space.

action.name: Wind Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The paolumu exhales blast of strong wind in a 60 foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, taking 38 ({@damage 11d6}) thunder damage and knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save or half as much on a successful one and not knocked {@condition prone}. The wind tunnel disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.

Paolumu is a bat-like wyvern that slightly resembles the Honduran white bat. Like said bat species, Paolumu is covered in white fur and has a pink face. Though it is covered in fur, Paolumu also has some brown scales covering its back, underbelly, and tail. The Paolumu has rodent-like buck teeth this is because its diet consists of the eggs that comes off the coral which it sucks in using its incredible breathing power.

Inside of Paolumu's neck is a special air sac that inflates once it has sucked in enough air. Once its air sac has inflated, Paolumu is able to float in the air like a balloon and able to attack foes from above. While floating, Paolumu will use its hardtail to batter foes at close range. Paolumu is also able to breathe wind at foes, it can also use its inhaling powers to draw in hunters closer or to make them stagger.
Paolumu are fairly calm unless provoked by a threat. Once provoked, they will become aggressive.

items.name: Paolumu Scale
entries: While you are wearing this armor, you can use your reaction or bonus action to gain resistance to cold damage until the end of your next turn. You can use this property twice, regaining all uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Paolumu Shell
entries: You have a +2 bonus to {@skill Acrobatics} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Paolumu Pelt
entries: {@i Stamina Surge+1.} While wearing this armor, you can use an action to cast the {@spell haste} spell from it once per day, but can target only yourself when you do so and you gain 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion} when the spell ends.

items.name: Paolumu Webbing
entries: {@i Windproof.} Наложенные вами заклинания, такие как {@spell fog cloud}, больше не могут быть рассеяны ветром, магическим или иным, пока вы носите эту броню.

items.name: Lumu Gem
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can cast the {@spell enlarge/reduce|PHB|enlarge} spell from it. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Paolumu Scale
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to Dexterity saving throws while attuned to this weapon.

items.name: Paolumu Shell
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to speak its command word and exhale a blast of strong wind in a 45-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} thunder damage and be knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save or half as much on a successful one and is not knocked prone.
После использования это свойство нельзя использовать снова, пока вы не закончите длительный отдых.

items.name: Paolumu Pelt
entries: While flying, you can take the {@action dodge} action as a bonus action while you hold this weapon.

items.name: Paolumu Webbing
entries: {@i Master Mounter.} You have advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks when attempting to {@action Climb Onto a Bigger Creature|DMG} (DMG p.271) while you are attuned to this weapon.

items.name: Lumu Gem
entries: {@i (Gunlance only) Artillery+.} Пока вы настроены на это оружие, ваш виверновый огонь теперь может быть использован дважды за долгий отдых, и вы можете добавить ваш модификатор силы к урону ваших атак снарядами.

items.name: Nourishing Extract
entries: A material that replaces the {@item catalyst|AGMH} for crafting {@item demondrug|AGMH} or {@item armorskin|AGMH} potions. It can also be used in place of {@item mega nutrients|AGMH} when crafting {@item max potion|AGMH}s or {@item ancient potion|AGMH}s.

trait.name: Blind Panic
entries: If the paolumu is flying and becomes {@condition blinded}. It panics, ending its enlarge and falls {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The paolumu makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage while enlarged.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage, or 9 ({@damage 3d4 + 2}) piercing damage while enlarged.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the paolumu magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the paolumu is Medium, it can hover, roll one additional weapon damage die on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the paolumu lacks the room to become Medium, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: Wind Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The paolumu exhales blast of strong wind in a 30 foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) thunder damage and knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save or half as much on a successful one and not knocked {@condition prone}. The wind tunnel disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.

Paolumu is a bat-like wyvern that slightly resembles the Honduran white bat. Like said bat species, Paolumu is covered in white fur and has a pink face. Though it is covered in fur, Paolumu also has some brown scales covering its back, underbelly, and tail. The Paolumu has rodent-like buck teeth this is because its diet consists of the eggs that comes off the coral which it sucks in using its incredible breathing power.

Inside of Paolumu's neck is a special air sac that inflates once it has sucked in enough air. Once its air sac has inflated, Paolumu is able to float in the air like a balloon and able to attack foes from above. While floating, Paolumu will use its hardtail to batter foes at close range. Paolumu is also able to breathe wind at foes, it can also use its inhaling powers to draw in hunters closer or to make them stagger.
Paolumu are fairly calm unless provoked by a threat. Once provoked, they will become aggressive.

items.name: Paolumu Pup Scale
entries: Пока вы носите эту броню, получаемый вами урон от холода уменьшается на 3.

items.name: Paolumu Pup Shell
entries: You have a +1 bonus to {@skill Acrobatics} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Paolumu Pup Pelt
entries: While you wear this armor a ruff (also known as a millstone collar) appears as part of your attire. You do not gain any benefit from the ruff, except that it makes you look more regal.

items.name: Paolumu Pup Scale
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to speak its command word and exhale a blast of strong wind in a 45-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and be knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save or half as much on a successful one and is not knocked prone.
После использования это свойство нельзя использовать снова, пока вы не закончите длительный отдых.

items.name: Paolumu Pup Shell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals thunder damage, add 1/2 of your proficiency bonus to that damage.

items.name: Paolumu Pup Pelt
entries: {@i Artillery.} While attuned to this weapon, your wyvernfire can now be used twice per long rest.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: The paratoad explodes when it drops to 0 hit points. Each creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the paralysis on a success.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The paratoad's long jump is up to 10 feet and its high jump is up to 5 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} попадание, радиус действия 5 футов, одна цель. {@h}1 колющее повреждение.

trait.name: Countershading
entries: While in water, the plesioth can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The plesioth makes two attacks, one Hipcheck attack and one tail attack.

action.name: Hipcheck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} попадание, радиус действия 10 футов, одна цель. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d12 + 4}) урон от удара.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} попадание, радиус действия 10 футов, одна цель. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) урон от удара.

action.name: Water Jet {@recharge 5}
entries: The plesioth releases a high pressure stream of water in an 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide or across a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage and not on a successful one.

action.name: Slither
entries: The plesioth up to its speed on its belly without provoking attacks of opportunity, during this move it may move through other creatures. Any creatures the plesioth moves through must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

Plesioth are bipedal monsters with a wyvern-esque body structure. They have webbed feet and a paddle-like tail, and are covered in shiny, fish-like scales. Their mouth is filled with shark-like teeth, and their eyes glow a bright yellow. Their head and back feature large fins which can fold in and out at will.

Plesioth do not possess gills for breathing underwater, so they have to come up for air every so often to fill their lungs with air. In addition to having lungs these creatures can also breath through their skin like an amphibian or sea snake. The fins of Plesioth allow it to swim fast enough to pass a galloping horse. Covering a Plesioth's body is these shiny black scales used to hold in moisture. A scale from older Plesioth can fend off claw and fang attacks. Plesioth have powerful jaws that can crush the shell of Carapaceon, and other armored species, making preying on those species easier. One of its most well-known features is its ability to breath high-pressurized water at its foes. The water that it uses is swallowed while swimming before Plesioth actually uses it as a weapon.

Plesioth can fire highly pressurized jets of water at foes, and can use their massive size and weight to crush and batter attackers. They are highly adept at swimming and are both agile and deadly in the water. Plesioth are ambush predators, adapted to stalking prey from the water and attacking by surprise. They can occasionally be seen on land. Plesioth are commonly found in large bodies of water in a wide variety of environments, such as the jungle, flooded forests, great lake and the coastal ocean waters.

items.name: Plesioth Scale
entries: {@i Airborne.} While wearing this armor, you can cast the {@spell jump} spell from it as a bonus action at will, but can target only yourself when you do so.

items.name: Plesioth Fin
entries: {@i Speed Eating.} Пока вы настроены на эту броню, вы можете использовать любой расходный материал, такой как зелье или пища, в качестве бонусного действия; пока вы являетесь тем, кто его потребляет.

items.name: Plesioth Webbing
entries: {@i Master Mounter.} You have advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks when attempting to {@action Climb Onto a Bigger Creature|DMG} (DMG p.271) while you are attuned to this armor.

items.name: Plesioth Head
entries: {@i Survivor.} When an ally, that you can see, is reduced to 0 hit points you can use your reaction to gain +1 AC, +1 damage, and +1 to attack rolls for 1 minute. Once this property has been used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Wyvern Stone
entries: {@i Wide-Range.} Когда вы используете {@table plants|AGMH|Herbs}, {@item Antidote|AGMH}с, {@item Cool Drink|AGMH}с, {@item Hot Drink|AGMH}с, {@table plants|AGMH|Adamant Seeds, or Might Seeds}, все другие существа в радиусе 10 футов от вас получают его эффект.

items.name: Plesioth Fang
entries: {@i Abnormal Status Atk up (S).} Каждый раз, когда вы накладываете на существо или предмет состояние, которое имеет продолжительность 1 минута или больше, максимальная продолжительность этого состояния увеличивается на 6 секунд.

items.name: Plesioth Fin
entries: {@i FastCharge.} When you roll for initiative, your greatsword, longsword, charge blade, or tonfas gains 1 charge, spirit, or phial charge.

items.name: Plesioth Head
entries: {@i Capturer.} When you capture a creature, you gain one extra material from it.

items.name: Wyvern Stone
entries: {@i Quick Load.} You can reload as a free action while you are attuned to this weapon.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the popo moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the popo can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The popo makes one gore attack and one stomp attack.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} попадание, радиус действия 5 футов, одна цель. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) колющего урона.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} попадание, радиус действия 5 футов, одна цель. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) урон от удара.

A large grazing herbivore, Popo is somewhat easy prey for anything larger than itself. Its size and tusks only work to deter smaller predators. Popo are very docile creatures and will run when one of their members in a group is under attack or when a threat enters their area. They will also group together when a large monster is near, like the {@creature Aptonoth|MHMM} in more temperate climates.

items.name: Popo Tongue
entries: Can be cooked ({@dc 10}). A creature who consumes the cooked tongue can choose any one language. It can read, write, and speak that language for 1 hour.

items.name: Raw Meat
entries: При приготовлении обеспечивает 2-дневный рацион.

items.name: Jumbo Bone
entries: Необычный материал для улучшения брони.

trait.name: Diet
entries: A creature that is {@condition poisoned} by the pukei-pukei suffers from an additional effects based on what its eaten. Roll {@dice 1d4}, the number determines the additional condition of its poison. On a 1, {@condition stunned}; On a 2, {@condition deafened}; On a 3, {@condition paralyzed}; On a 4, {@condition blinded}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pukei-pukei makes three attacks: two with its tongue and one with its tail. It can replace any one of these with its poison spit attack.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} попадание, досягаемость 5 футов, одна цель. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) повреждений от удара.

action.name: Poison Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Poison Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The pukei-pukei sprays poisonous gas from its tail in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and are not {@condition poisoned} on a successful one. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Pukei-Pukei slightly resembles a chameleon, and its eyes are similar to frogs. It has a pair of wings and is covered in green scales that vary in color throughout its body excluding its underbelly. Its underbelly is covered in white osteoderm-like protrusions. Despite being reptilian in nature, Pukei-Pukei has vibrant feathers around its neck and wings.

Pukei-Pukei is known to store the properties of its food within its mouth and tail before combining them with its own poison. By doing so, it can spew poison from its mouth and tail for protection. This poison varies depending on its previous meal.
Pukei-Pukei is known to bully smaller monsters, but will flee from larger ones.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Shell
entries: You have a +2 bonus to {@skill Deception} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Scale
entries: {@i Botanist.} Когда вы успешно собираете {@table plants|AGMH|plant} ресурс, вместо этого вы собираете 2.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Quill
entries: Пока вы носите эти доспехи, вы можете использовать свою реакцию или бонусное действие, чтобы получить сопротивление урону от яда до конца вашего следующего хода. После использования этого свойства вы не сможете использовать его снова, пока не закончите длительный отдых.

items.name: Pukei-Poison Sac
entries: Whenever you make a saving throw against the {@condition poisoned} condition, you do so with a +2 bonus.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Sac
entries: {@i Item Prolonger.} Каждый раз, когда вы используете расходный предмет, имеющий длительность, его длительность увеличивается еще на 6 секунд.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Wing
entries: While wearing this armor, you can conjure 1 of 4 types of nut into the palm of your hand and consume it as an action. Choose one creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. Both you and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or suffer the effects of the nut for 1 minute. Roll a d4 to determine the effect of the nut;

On a 1, {@condition stunned}; On a 2, {@condition deafened}; On a 3, {@condition paralyzed}; On a 4, {@condition blinded}. Both creatures can repeat this saving throw at the end of their turn, ending the effecting on a success. You can use this property a number of times equal to your Constitution Modifier, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Shell
entries: You have proficiency with the {@item herbalism kit|PHB} while attuned to this weapon. If you are already proficient you double your proficiency bonus when using it.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Scale
entries: While touching this weapon, you can use an action to determine which way is north. This property functions only on the Material Plane.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Quill
entries: Пока вы настроены на это оружие, вы можете использовать его как фокус заклинания.

items.name: Pukei-Poison Sac
entries: Когда вы произносите заклинание, наносящее урон ядом, добавьте к этому урону 1/2 вашего бонуса мастерства.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Sac
entries: This weapon has 3 runes. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend 1 of its runes to have the target make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effecting on a success. This weapon regains 1 expended rune daily at dawn.

items.name: Pukei-Pukei Wing
entries: When you cast a spell that deals poison damage, you gain a +1 bonus to its spell attack roll or increase its spell save DC by 1.

items.name: Pukei-Poison Sac
entries: You can make a {@dc 10} Wisdom ({@item Poisoner's Kit|PHB}) check using this material as its ingredient plus two {@item vial|PHB}s. On a success you create two vials of {@item basic poison (vial)|PHB|basic poison} (PHB p. 153). On a fail, the material is destroyed.

items.name: Jumbo Bone
entries: Необычный материал для улучшения брони.

trait.name: Glowing Chin
entries: The uragaan's Jack-o'-lantern chin glows from its eyes and mouth, releasing bright light in a 30-foot cone and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Rise Again (1/day)
entries: When the uragaan is reduced to 0 hit points, it resurrects on initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties). When it resurrects, the uragaan's hit points are healed to its maximum, its type is changed from wyvern to undead, and it gains the undead fortitude trait.
Presented for reference, the {@creature zombie}'s {@b Undead Fortitude} trait:

{@i If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.}

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The uragaan makes one tail attack and two chin slam attacks. Or it makes three attacks with its pumpkin toss.

action.name: Jack-o'-lantern Chin Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Pumpkin Toss
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is covered in pumpkin guts.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Roll {@recharge 5}
entries: The uragaan rolls its body into a wheel and moves up to its speed, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking opportunity attacks. Any creatures the Uragaan moves through must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Emit Flames
entries: (2/per Long rest). The uragaan releases a wave of fire from its underside in a 10-foot radius around it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage and catches fire on a failed save or half as much on a successful one and does not catch fire. Until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

The pumpkin uragaan possesses a near identical body shape to the normal {@creature uragaan|MHMM}, yet has a different coloration. Its back and belly are a dark purple while the rest of its body is a pumpkin orange. Its chin is no longer plated with a rock-like shell, but instead is covered by a large jack-o'-lantern.

It has been said that on All Hallows' Eve, a pumpkin uragaan appears in a great pumpkin patch on the outskirts of one of the many villages in the old world. By dawn, the village is left burning, broken, and covered in pumpkin; and the pumpkin uragaan vanishes, until the next All Hallows' Eve.

items.name: Pumpkin.U Carapace
entries: {@i Constitution.} Время действия замедляющих эффектов, таких как заклинание {@spell slow} или атака дыханием медного дракона, уменьшается наполовину, пока вы носите эту броню.

items.name: P.Firecell Stone
entries: Когда вы должны преуспеть в броске спасения или быть сбитым с ног {@condition prone}, вы делаете это с преимуществом.

items.name: Pumpkin.U Scute
entries: {@i Health Boost.} Когда вы носите эту броню, ваш максимум хит-пойнтов увеличивается на 1 за каждый уровень персонажа, который у вас есть.

items.name: Pumpkin Flame Sac
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can use a bonus action to speak its command word and exhale fire at a target within 30 feet of you. The target must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
После использования это свойство нельзя использовать снова, пока вы не закончите длительный отдых.

items.name: Pumpkin.U Marrow
entries: {@i Guts+.} Когда вас снижают до 0 хит-поинтов, но не убивают прямо, вы можете упасть до 1 хит-поинта. После использования этого свойства вы не сможете использовать его снова, пока не закончите длительный отдых.

items.name: Pumpkin.U Ruby
entries: {@i Mushroomancer+.} While wearing this armor you can digest {@table mushrooms|AGMH} that would otherwise be inedible and gain their advantageous effects. The more pumpkin uragaan materials equipped in your armor or trinkets, the more mushrooms you can eat.

entries.name: 1 pumpkin uragaan material
items: Blue Mushroom, {@i Restores a 1d4 hit points.}
Toadstool, {@i You regain 1 hit points at the start of each of your turns for 1 minute.}

entries.name: 2 pumpkin uragaan material
items: Nitroshroom, {@i Your Strength score increases by +2 for 1 minute.}
Parashroom, {@i Your AC becomes 13 + your Dexterity modifier for the next 8 hours.}

entries.name: 3 pumpkin uragaan material
items: Гриб Хаоса, {@i You are {@condition poisoned} на 1 час и получает 5 временных хит-пойнтов за уровень персонажа в течение следующих 10 минут}.
Биндшрум, {@i Your speed increases by 15 feet for 1 hour.}
Exciteshroom, {@i Provides one of the other mushroom effects, roll a d6 to see which one:}

items.name: Pumpkin.U Carapace
entries: This weapon acts as a focus for your spellcasting.

items.name: P.Firecell Stone
entries: Your weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

items.name: Pumpkin.U Scale
entries: {@i Pumpkin Carver.} While you are attuned to this armor, you can carve a creature of CR 8 or lower 1 extra time.

items.name: Pumpkin.U Scute
entries: {@i Partbreaker+1.} You deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage when you critically hit with this weapon.

items.name: Pumpkin Flame Sac
entries: This weapon has 4 runes. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast the {@spell flaming sphere} spell (save DC 13) from it. For 1 rune, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional rune you expend. A flaming sphere takes the form of a flaming jack-o'-lantern when cast in this way.
This weapon regains 1d4 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the weapon's last rune, roll a d20. On a 1, the runes cannot recharge for a week.

items.name: Pumpkin.U Jaw
entries: {@i Resentment.} До конца вашего хода вы получаете бонус +1 к броскам атаки и урона против любого существа, которое нанесло вам урон с конца вашего последнего хода.

trait.name: Sensitive Ears
entries: If the qurupeco takes thunder damage or a thunder spell is used within 60 feet of it, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The qurupeco makes three attacks: one with its flint and two with its peck.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Flint
entries: If the qurupeco jumps at least 5 feet towards a creature as part of its movement, it can then use this action to strike its flint-like wingtips together, creating a small explosion in that creatures space. That creature must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage on failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Call for Aid (1/day)
entries: The qurupeco calls out for assistance, roll a {@dice d6}; If 1 or 2, {@dice 1d4} {@creature Jaggi|MHMM} appear; if 3 or 4, a {@creature Great Jaggi|MHMM} appears; if 5 or 6 a {@creature Royal Ludroth|MHMM} appears.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The qurupeco's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

entries: The Qurupeco resembles a large bird with Pterosaur-like features, such as a fanged beak and leathery wings. It is mainly green colored with some scales being tinted yellow, it also has a clump of iridescent purple feathers on its back between its shoulders. The Qurupeco has a short, stubby brown crest extending from the back of its head. It uses its masterful vocal mimicry abilities to call for aid from various monsters, as well as healing them and boosting their abilities. The Qurupeco's soft crest stretches over the top of its head and when calling opens out into the shape of a megaphone, amplifying its calls. Its most notable feature however is its bright red vocal sac which inflates when calling.

The Qurupeco also has a pair of thick, bulky growths on its wings which produce sparks when struck against each other, much like flints. It uses these to ignite its mucus, causing fiery explosions. Its tail is shaped like a fan and can unfold revealing brightly colored skin, most likely as a warning for any would-be attacker. The Qurupeco's feet seem to have only 3 frontal digits on each foot. It may also have a back digit, but its stubby appearance makes it looks more like a heel. Its feet are also partially webbed.

items.name: Qurupeco Scale
entries: Пока вы носите эти доспехи, вы можете использовать свою реакцию или бонусное действие, чтобы получить сопротивление урону от огня до конца вашего следующего хода. После использования этого свойства вы не сможете использовать его снова, пока не закончите длительный отдых.

items.name: Qurupeco Feather
entries: Whenever you finish a long rest you may attempt a {@dc 15} Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check using an {@filter instrument|items|type=instrument} you are proficient with. On a success, you gain inspiration if you do not already have it.

items.name: Vivid Feather
entries: You have a +2 bonus to {@skill Performance} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Alluring Beak
entries: {@i Recovery Speed.} Каждый раз, когда вы бросаете бросок на восстановление хит-пойнтов, удваивайте количество восстанавливаемых хит-пойнтов.

items.name: Flintstone
entries: Your armor is decorated with bird carvings. It has 10 runes. While wearing it, you can use an action to expend 1 rune from the armor and cause it to create one of the following sounds out to a range of 60 feet: a finch's chirp, a raven's caw, a duck's quack, a chicken's cluck, a goose's honk, a loon's call, a turkey's gobble, a seagull's cry, an owl's hoot, or an eagle's shriek.
This armor regains 1d6 + 4 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the last rune, roll a d20. On a 1, the runes cannot recharge for a week

items.name: Qurupeco Scale
entries: You gain proficiency with the {@item horn|PHB} musical instruments. If you are already proficient, you double your proficiency bonus when using it.

items.name: Qurupeco Feather
entries: While holding this weapon, you can use an action to summon a {@creature jaggi|MHMM} to your aid for 1 hour. It will act on your turn in the initiative and will flee if you or your allies attempt to harm it. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again for one week.

items.name: Vivid Feather
entries: Пока вы настроены на это оружие, вы можете использовать его как фокус заклинания.

items.name: Alluring Beak
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon it must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes {@condition charmed} by you until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target becomes immune to this effect for 24 hours.

items.name: Flintstone
entries: Когда вы произносите заклинание, наносящее урон огнем, вы получаете бонус +1 к броску атаки заклинания.

items.name: Screamer Sac
entries: A crafting material used to make {@item sonic bomb|AGMH}s.

items.name: Med Monsterbone
entries: Редкий материал для улучшения брони.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Web (2/long rest)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a {@dc 12} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to slashing damage; immunity to bludgeoning, fire, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The rachnoid exhales fire in a 15-foot line that is 5-feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc l2} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The infant form of {@creature Rakna-Kadaki|MHMM}. At this stage in their life cycle, they cling to their mother's abdomen, feeding on scraps of her regurgitated prey. From birth, they are instantly able to spit webs that are just as strong as their mother's, which they use to bind prey or swiftly move about at her command.

items.name: Rachnoid Silk
entries: While you are grappling a target you can use an action to speak this armor's command word, causing rachnoid silk covering your armor to wrap around the {@condition grappled} target. Until you or the creature takes fire damage, or until it breaks free of your grapple, it has disadvantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Sharp claw
entries: Ваше колющее оружие наносит дополнительно 1 косой урон.

items.name: Rachnoid Silk
entries: Can be used to craft {@item pitfall trap|AGMH} (AGtMH p.63) by combining it with a {@item trap tool|AGMH} using {@item smith's tools|PHB} ({@dc 15}).

items.name: Monster Fluid
entries: Необычный или редкий материал для модернизации, который можно использовать для изготовления оружия или доспехов.

trait.name: Bone Armor
entries: The Radobaan is covered in the bones of fallen creatures granting it +4 AC. When the radobaan takes more than 30 damage in a single turn, the bones snap and break reducing the bonus AC by 1.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The radobaan makes one tail attack and two chin slam attacks.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Chin Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Roll {@recharge 5}
entries: The radobaan rolls its body into a wheel and moves up to its speed, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking opportunity attacks. Any creatures the radobaan moves through must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 42 ({@damage 12d6}) slashing damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Sleeping Gas (2/Day)
entries: The radobaan releases sleeping gas from its underside. All creatures within 15 ft. must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or, they fall {@condition unconscious} until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.

Radobaan looks very similar to {@creature Uragaan|MHMM} in many aspects but has its own unique features. Unlike Uragaan, Radobaan is covered in a tar-like substance that sticks rows of bones onto its body. These bones vary in size throughout the Radobaan's body but the most distinctive ones are on its legs. The bones on its legs are the horns of {@creature Diablos|MHMM}. Though the bones aren't as strong as ore, they are lighter. This lighter weight makes Radobaan faster than Uragaan. Despite not eating ore, Radobaan still has a massive chin like Uragaan. Like Uragaan, Radobaan can roll into a wheel and run over enemies.

It also can emit coma-inducing gas from its body like Uragaan. Radobaan can be fairly calm unless provoked by a threat unlike their ore eating relatives the Uraagan which will become hostile regardless of being threatened or not. Once provoked, they will turn violent.

items.name: Radobaan Shell
entries: {@i Guard.} Вас нельзя толкнуть или опрокинуть назад, пока вы носите эту броню.

items.name: Radobaan Scale
entries: Пока вы носите эту броню, у вас есть сопротивление к урону от огня.

items.name: Radobaan Oilshell
entries: {@i Tremor-Proof.} You cannot be knocked {@condition prone} while you wear this armor.

items.name: Radobaan Marrow
entries: {@i Negate Bleeding.} You are immune to wounding effects, such as the {@creature Odogaron|MHMM}'s bloody wound or the {@creature bearded devil}'s infernal wound while you wear this armor.

items.name: Radobaan Gem
entries: While you wear this armor, any creature that hits you with a melee weapon, an unarmed strike, or a natural melee weapon takes {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.

items.name: R.Sleep Sac
entries: This weapon has 4 runes. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend 1 of its runes to have the target make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, or it falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute, until the sleeper takes damage, or until someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. This weapon regains 1 expended rune daily at dawn.

items.name: R.Sleep Sac
entries: A Material that replaces the {@table plants|AGMH|sleep herb} when crafting {@item tranq bomb|AGMH}s or {@item tranq ammo (1)|AGMH|tranq ammo}. (100 uses).

trait.name: Detonate
entries: At the start of the brachydios' turn, the slime explodes. Each creature in the slimes area, takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the brachydios fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Raging Fury
entries: While it has half hit points or fewer, the brachydios gains the following benefits:

items: The brachydios' AC is increased by 3.
It has resistance to bludgeoning damage and vulnerability to cold damage.
It cannot be {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition poisoned}.
Its slime now explodes on initiative 20.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brachydios makes three attacks: one with its horn and two with its fist.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage + 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and green slime covers the terrain in a 10-foot radius around the target (including the target's space).

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage + 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and green slime covers the terrain in a 5-foot radius around the target (including the target's space).

action.name: Chemical Reaction {@recharge 5}
entries: The brachydios slams his horn into the ground and causes a chain of explosions in a 60 foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) fire damage + 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Fist Attack
entries: The brachydios makes a fist attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The brachydios moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Slam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The brachydios makes a horn attack or uses chemical reaction.
Theorized to have grown isolated in a special environment, Raging Brachydios is a rare special {@creature Brachydios|MHMM} individual that has abnormal activation of its Slime Mold.

Raging Brachydios is a predator capable of taking on and even killing other large predatory monsters, just like Brachydios. In line with their chosen habitat and absurd strength, Raging Brachydios will encounter far more dangerous foes than regular Brachydios, but will fight them and potentially win nonetheless.

Raging Brachydios have many of the same adaptions as Brachydios, however, there is a few differences between them. Raging Brachydios are extremely large compared to normal Brachydios, but are only slightly slower than them. This size difference stems from their advanced age. The main adaption that puts them apart from normal Brachydios is the large amount of slime mold found on their body.

This Ancient slime mold is not only more active then regular slime mold, but also explodes far more violently. This provides Raging Brachydios far more potent explosions that those of its peers. This forces Raging Brachydios to develop its own special Indestructible Ebonshell, to withstand its own explosions, lest it kill itself. This in turn provides it nigh-impenetrable protection from the natural weaponry of nearly all other living creatures.

items.name: Indestructible Ebonshell
entries: {@i Handicraft+3.} For 24 hours, you gain proficiency with three artisan tools of your choice each dawn.

items.name: Flashpoint Slime
entries: {@i (Requires a shield)} While you are attuned to this armor, you can use an action to prime your shield. The next time you take damage from a melee attack, fire erupts from the shield and bathes the attacker in flames. The attacker must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 5d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You can use this property twice, regaining all expended uses on a short or long rest.

items.name: Brachydios Lash
entries: {@i Adrenaline.} The first time you drop below half of your hit point maximum in combat, you gain a rush of adrenaline. On your next turn your movement speed doubles and you can take one extra action.

items.name: Brach Obliterator
entries: {@i (Lance & Greatsword only)} Your Guard AC bonus now lasts until the start of your next turn and you cannot be knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Immortal Reactor
entries: {@i Biology.} Пока вы носите эти доспехи, вы владеете навыками {@item dung bomb|AGMH}, и у вас есть иммунитет к эффектам ослепления, таким как {@condition waterblight|MHMM}, {@condition iceblight|MHMM} или заклинание {@spell blight}.

items.name: Brach Warhead
entries: Пока вы носите эту броню, вы невосприимчивы к урону от огня.

items.name: Brachydios Pallium
entries: {@i Iron Wall+.} You have a +3 bonus to your armor class while you wear this armor.

items.name: Indestructible Ebonshell
entries: {@i Speed Sharpening.} You can spend 1 minute sharpening a bladed weapon. When you hit a creature for the first time after sharpening it, the weapon deals its maximum piercing or slashing damage to the target.

items.name: Flashpoint Slime
entries: {@i (Gunlance only) Artillery+2.} While attuned to this weapon, your wyvernfire can now be used three times per long rest and you can add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the damage of your shell attacks.

items.name: Brachydios Lash
entries: {@i Weakness Exploit+.} When you have advantage on an attack roll with this weapon and you hit the target, you can have your weapon deal its maximum damage if the lower of the two d20 rolls would also hit the target (all extra damage dice must still be rolled). You can use this property a number of times equal to your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice), regaining all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: Brach Obliterator
entries: {@i Bombardier+.} The weapon has 12 runes, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast one of the following Spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell aganazzar's scorcher|XGE} (2 runes), {@spell heat metal} (2 runes), {@spell scorching ray} (2 runes), {@spell melf's minute meteors|XGE} (3 runes), {@spell wall of fire} (4 runes), {@spell delayed blast fireball} (7 runes). The weapon regains 1d8 + 4 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the last rune it cannot regain any runes for one week.

items.name: Immortal Reactor
entries: {@i Brawn.} While you are attuned to this weapon, it you gain the following effects:

items: Once per turn when a creature must succeed on a saving throw or become {@condition stunned} by the effect of one of your weapon attacks, they make the save with disadvantage.

Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, it must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}. A creature cannot gain more than 2 levels of exhaustion from this weapon's property.

items.name: Brach Warhead
entries: {@i Blast Coat+.} This material provides one of the following weapon properties depending on which weapon it is placed in:

items: (Heavy Bowgun) Your {@item cluster ammo (1)|AGMH|cluster ammo} deals an extra 3d6 fire damage.
(Bow) Your {@item blast coating|AGMH} deals an extra 2d6 fire damage.

items.name: Brachydios Pallium
entries: {@i Spirit+.} When fighting a Huge or larger creature, this weapon deals 1d8 extra weapon damage and its crit range is increased by 2.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the rajang moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Fist Attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: Прыжок раджанга в длину достигает 30 футов, а в высоту - 15 футов, с разбега или без него.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Раджанг наносит два удара кулаком.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Meteor {@recharge 6}
entries: The rajang jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to roll into a ball and come crashing down in a space, within 40 feet of it, that contains one or more creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the rajang's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the rajang's space.

action.name: Lighting Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The rajang exhales lightning in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Раджанг движется со своей скоростью, не провоцируя атаки по возможности.

legendary.name: Kick
entries: Раджанг делает одну атаку ударом.

legendary.name: Quake (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The rajang reaches for the sky and slams its body onto the ground causing the ground to shake violently. Each creature within 30 feet of the rajang must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Any creature that fails this save by 5 or more is also {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

Раджанг - ультраагрессивное существо, которое редко встречается и редко выживает. Раджанг считается вершиной непревзойденного физического мастерства и, как говорят, одиночкой, и эта изолированная жизнь затрудняет определение его территориальных пристрастий.

Раджанг очень похож на {@creature Blangonga|MHMM} своим внешним видом и движениями, даже заимствует некоторые из его атак. Однако заметными отличиями раджанга являются более широкие мышцы, большие рога, волосатый кончик хвоста и способность использовать атаки, основанные на электричестве. Самая заметная атака раджанга - способность выстреливать электричеством из пасти в виде взрыва или луча. Их ненавидят многие искатели приключений из-за их сочетания скорости, агрессивности и силы.

Раджанг лучше всего описывается как ультраагрессивный вид. Они готовы напасть и убить все, что им угрожает, причем жестоко. В Новом мире показано, что они готовы бросить вызов монстрам, иногда в два или три раза превосходящим их по размерам, и даже могут одолеть или сравняться с такими монстрами в Турфийских войнах.

items.name: Rajang Fang
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Insight} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Rajang Blackfur
entries: При температуре до -20 градусов по Фаренгейту вы не получаете никакого вреда, пока носите эту броню.

items.name: Rajang Tail
entries: {@i Imperial Wrath.} You have advantage on {@skill Intimidation} checks when interacting with nobles while you wear this armor.

items.name: Rajang Claw
entries: Когда вы должны преуспеть в броске спасения или быть сбитым с ног {@condition prone}, вы делаете это с преимуществом.

items.name: Rajang Horn
entries: You have resistance to thunder damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Gold Rajang Pelt
entries: You have immunity to thunder damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Rajang Fang
entries: {@i (Insect Glaive only)} As an action you can hurl this weapon and speak this weapon's command word, it transforms into a bolt of lightning, forming a line 5 feet wide that extends out from you to a target within 120 feet. Each creature in the line excluding you and the target must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The lightning bolt turns back into a javelin when it reaches the target. Make a ranged weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes damage from the javelin plus {@damage 4d6} lightning damage. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Rajang Blackfur
entries: Your weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} lightning damage.

items.name: Rajang Tail
entries: {@i (Spellcaster only)} This weapon has 7 runes. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast the {@spell lightning bolt} spell (save {@dc 15}) from it. For 1 rune, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional rune you expend.
This weapon regains 1d6 + 1 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the weapon's last rune, roll a d20. On a 1, the runes cannot recharge for a week.

items.name: Rajang Claw
entries: {@i Critical Eye.} Дальность критического удара ваших атак оружием увеличивается на 1.

items.name: Rajang Horn
entries: Your weapon gains the following properties. When one of these properties is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Lightning
entries: When you hit with a melee attack using the weapon, you can cause the target to take an extra {@damage 2d6} lightning damage.

items.name: Thunder
entries: When you hit with a melee attack using the weapon, you can cause the weapon to emit a crack of thunder, audible out to 300 feet. The target you hit must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Lightning Strike
entries: You can use an action to cause a bolt of lightning to leap from the weapon's tip in a line that is 5 feet wide and 120 feet long. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 9d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Thunderclap
entries: You can use an action to cause the weapon to issue a deafening thunderclap, audible out to 600 feet. Each creature within 60 feet of you (not including you) must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and becomes {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't deafened.

items.name: Thunder and Lightning
entries: You can use an action to use the Lightning Strike and Thunderclap properties at the same time. Doing so doesn't expend the daily use of those properties, only the use of this one.

items.name: Gold Rajang Pelt
entries: Your weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d8} lightning damage.

trait.name: Silk Gown (After the gown is destroyed; {@recharge 6})
entries: As a bonus action the rakna covers its body in a silk webbing. The webbing can be attacked and destroyed (AC 19; hp 64; immunity to bludgeoning, fire, poison, and psychic damage). When a creature makes a melee weapon attack that fails to hit the rakna or silk gown by 5 or less its weapon becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful {@dc 18} Strength check to pull free. If the attack is with a natural weapon, the creature is also {@condition grappled}. Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}.

trait.name: Damage Transfer (Requires silk gown)
entries: While the rakna's body is covered by its silk gown, it takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the silk gown takes the other half.

trait.name: Rachnoids. (Requires silk gown)
entries: While its body is covered by its silk gown, the rakna always has five {@creature rachnoid|MHMM}s on its abdomen. When the silk gown is destroyed, the rachnoids fall off the rakna and use their reactions to flee by burrowing underground.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The rakna can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The rakna's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the rakna knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The rakna ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rakna uses its command rachnoid (if able). It then makes three attacks; two with its claws, and one with its abdomen.

action.name: Abdomen
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 6d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage or 18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage when covered by its silk gown.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Command Rachnoids (Requires silk gown)
entries: The rakna uses one of the following actions:

items.name: Move
entries: The rakna launches three rachnoids up to 30 feet away and pulls itself to that location.

items.name: Fire Breath
entries: The rakna launches all five rachnoids off its abdomen, each landing at least 5 feet apart from each other and in a space within 20 feet of the rakna. Each rachnoid then uses its fire breath before being pulled back onto the rakna's abdomen.

items.name: Defend
entries: The rachnoids on the rakna's body attempt to shove a creature off the rakna. Roll a contested Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check using the rachnoids strength modifier. The rachnoid gains a +4 bonus to its check.

items.name: Web
entries: Up to three rachnoids use their web action.

action.name: Recharge Attack {@recharge 5}
entries: The rakna uses one of the following actions.

items.name: Fire Breath.
items.entry: The rakna spins in a circle and releases a gout of flame in a 30-foot radius around it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the rakna is on the ceiling of the area, the gout of flames is released in a 30-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point up to 30 feet directly below the rakna.

items.name: Web Spray.
items.entry: The rakna exhales webbing in a 60-foot cone in front of it. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a {@dc 18} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 30; vulnerability to slashing damage; immunity to bludgeoning, fire, poison, and psychic damage).

legendary.name: Command
entries: The rakna uses its command rachnoids action.

legendary.name: Flamethrower
entries: The rakna moves up to half its speed in a straight line while releasing a gout of flame in a 15-foot line that is 10 feet wide in front of it. During this movement it can pass through a Medium or smaller creature's space. Each creature in fire's path must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Web Landmine (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The rakna slams its abdomen on the ground sending three blobs of webbing into unoccupied spaces within 15 feet of it. When a creature that starts or enters a webbed area for the first time on a turn they are {@condition restrained} by the webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a {@dc 18} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can be attacked and destroyed (AC 18; hp 100; vulnerability to slashing damage; immunity to bludgeoning, fire, poison, and psychic damage).

Rakna-Kadaki are Temnocerans bristling with sharp curving spikes. Their body is covered in a purple carapace with several large spikes on the legs and the abdomen, which are used to hang their web. Unlike {@creature Nerscylla|MHMM}, Rakna-Kadaki have six legs, the first two pairs are walking legs and the last pair is held above the ground carrying the abdomen, and a pair of purplish-red, blunt pedipalps that can extend to over three times their length. The most peculiar trait of Rakna-Kadaki however is its "neck". Similar to pelican spiders, it has a long, extendable neck that can be "retracted" back on top of the thorax. Its head sports eight yellow eyes, as well as two pairs of chelicerae on its jaw.

Unlike most spiders, as well as Nerscylla, Rakna-Kadaki are capable of spitting silk from their mouth, and can spit several strands at the same time. They use this silk to bind their prey in web before finishing them off. They also capable spewing a stream of burning gas from its mouth, as well as expelling the same gas from the body.

Rakna-Kadaki are normally seen wearing their silk on the body, creating the appearance of a white gown. They also carry their {@creature rachnoid|MHMM|babies} around at all times, and can send them out to for coordinated attacks, such as spitting out globs of silk or pulling in their mother using their own silk.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Carapace
entries: {@i Constitution.} Время действия замедляющих эффектов, таких как заклинание {@spell slow} или атака дыханием медного дракона, уменьшается наполовину, пока вы носите эту броню.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Silk
entries: While you are grappling a target you can use an action to speak this armor's command word, causing rachnoid silk covering your armor to wrap around the {@condition grappled} target. Until you or the creature takes fire damage, or until it breaks free of your grapple, it has disadvantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier, regaining all expended use when you finish a long rest.

items.name: R.Queen Substance
entries: While you wear this armor small spiders emerge from it, like hatching from an egg sac. The spiders are friendly to you and crawl around your armor, but provide no other noticeable benefit.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Glowgut
entries: This armor has 3 runes. It regains 1d3 runes daily at dawn. As an action you can expend one or more runes to cast the {@spell web} spell (spell save {@dc 16}). For 1 rune, you cast the spell as normal. You can increase the size of the cubed area by 5 feet for each additional rune you expend.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Sharpclaw
entries: {@i Spider Climb.} While you wear this armor, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. However, the armor doesn't allow you to move this way on a slippery surface, such as one covered by ice or oil.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Spike
entries: You have resistance to fire and necrotic damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Drone Substance
entries: {@i Capture Novice.} While attuned to this weapon {@item tranq bomb|AGMH}s and {@item tranq ammo (1)|AGMH|tranq ammo} roll an extra 2d8 when they hit a creature.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Carapace
entries: While attuned to this weapon you can use a bonus action to fire a strand of webbing at a creature, object, or terrain within 30 feet of you and pull yourself to the closest adjacent space to the target. If the target is a creature, they can make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature avoids the webbing and you are unable to pull yourself to it. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Glowgut
entries: {@i Stamina Surge+2.} While attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to cast the {@spell haste} spell from it once per day, but can target only yourself when you do so and you gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} when the spell ends.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Sharpclaw
entries: Ваше оружие наносит дополнительные 1d8 повреждений огнем.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Spike
entries: {@i (Bowgun only) Spread up+.} When you hit a creature with spread ammo and they are within half your normal bowgun range, increase the damage die size by 1. Additionally instead of splitting the damage, the target takes full damage from the spread ammo and each adjacent creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw equal to your ammo save DC. On a failed save, the target is dealt the same damage as the target. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage as the target.

items.name: Drone Substance
entries: This oily like substance can be applied to the skin of a medium or smaller creature. Applying the substance takes 1 minute. The affected creature then has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks for 1 hour. During this time if they attempt to charm a creature with spells or spell-like abilities, the targeted creature has disadvantage on its saving throw.
{@i Cursed.} When applied to a creature, there is a 10% chance to attract nearby {@creature seltas|MHMM} while in urban areas. While in the wilds, there is a 50% chance to attract nearby seltas.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Silk
entries: Can be used to craft {@item pitfall trap+|AGMH} (AGtMH p.63) by combining it with a {@item trap tool|AGMH} using {@item smith's tools|PHB} ({@dc 17}).

items.name: R.Queen Substance
entries: A potent pheromone sometimes released by the rakna-kadaki. It is highly valued by nobles (sell value 1,500 gp).

items.name: Monster Broth
entries: Legendary material that can be used for weapons or armor.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rathalos makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its talons. While flying, it use its wings in place of its bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Wings
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage. The target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Fireball {@recharge 5}
entries: The rathalos exhales a fireball radius within 100 feet of its location. Each creature in a 10-foot radius Sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 45 ({@damage 13d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Rathalos are large, bipedal wyverns with a spiny, armored hide covering their body. Their outer shell features much brighter and more vibrant colors than that of their female counterpart, the Rathian. It is primarily bright red, with black markings throughout. Like the {@creature Rathian|MHMM}, Rathalos possess a flame sac which is used to produce deadly flaming projectiles from the mouth. The talons upon their feet are highly poisonous and are known to to inflict toxic mortal wounds on larger prey. In addition, their long, thick tail features a heavy spiked club at the end. Rathalos' wing membranes feature ornate patterns which are likely used to attract potential mates.

Rathalos are expert flyers, and as such are prone to hunting from the skies. By launching a surprise aerial attack, they can inflict poisonous wounds with their talons or burn prey with flaming projectiles. On the ground, Rathalos remain formidable opponents. Using their powerful legs, they can chase down prey from a distance. At a close enough range, they are known to use their sharp teeth to bite at foes as well. Some Rathalos are capable of staying in the air and launching a fireball before landing back to the ground.

Rathalos are highly territorial monsters, and as such, are aggressive towards intruders. They will chase away or attempt to kill any monster which may pose a threat to their land. While hunting, Rathalos will stalk prey from the air before swooping in for the kill. Once they have successfully brought down their prey, they will carry it away to eat in private, safe from scavengers or other large monsters which might attempt to steal the kill.

Rathalos have been spotted in many kinds of environments, from the temperate forest and hills to the extreme heat of a volcano. As a master of flight, they will travel far and wide, searching for prey from the skies.

items.name: Rathalos Scale
entries: {@i Detect+.} You gain a +2 bonus to your passive Perception while you wear this armor.

items.name: R.Inferno Sac
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can use a bonus action to speak its command word and exhale fire at a target within 30 feet of you. The target must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
После использования это свойство нельзя использовать снова, пока вы не закончите длительный отдых.

items.name: Rathalos Carapace
entries: You have a +1 bonus to your AC while you wear this armor.

items.name: Rathalos Webbing
entries: Когда вы должны преуспеть в броске спасения или быть сбитым с ног {@condition prone}, вы делаете это с преимуществом.

items.name: Rathalos Marrow
entries: Пока вы носите эту броню, вам не страшны температуры до 120 градусов по Фаренгейту.

items.name: Rathalos Wing
entries: While you are attuned to this armor you can cast the {@spell fly} spell. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

items.name: Rathalos Plate
entries: Пока вы носите эту броню, у вас есть сопротивление к урону от огня.

items.name: Rathalos Ruby
entries: Пока вы носите эту броню, у вас есть иммунитет к урону от огня.

items.name: R. Inferno Sac
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d6 fire damage.

items.name: Rathalos Marrow
entries: You can use a bonus action to speak this weapon's command word, causing flames to erupt from the weapon. These flames shed bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet.

items.name: Rathalos Tail
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, they must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. They may repeat the save at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success. On a successful save, the target is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

items.name: Rathalos Plate
entries: {@i Critical Eye.} Дальность критического удара ваших атак оружием увеличивается на 1.

items.name: Rathalos Ruby
entries: Ваше оружие наносит дополнительные 1d8 повреждений огнем.

items.name: Rathalos Tail
entries: Очень редкий материал для улучшения брони или оружия.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rathian makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its stinger. While flying, it use its talons in place of its bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Fireball {@recharge 5}
entries: The rathian exhales a fireball radius within 100 feet of its location. Each creature in a 10-foot radius Sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Rathian is a true flying wyvern similar in looks to her male counterpart, {@creature Rathalos|MHMM}. Her hide is a dull, muted green in contrast to the Rathalos's deep red, and her lower mandible features a long, protruding chin spike. Her upper back and wingtips are covered in a moss-like fur not seen on the Rathalos, and while her clubbed tail lacks bony spikes, it makes up for this with its ability to poison foes upon contact.

Rathian, like her mate, can generate flaming projectiles from her mouth. She can use the poisonous barbs on her tail club to inflict blunt-force, toxic wounds on foes, even if her tail was cut off. Her powerful legs allow her to run at high speeds, making her easily capable of chasing down most prey. Like the Rathalos, her vision is very keen, so {@item Flash Bomb|AGMH}s are useful in combat.

Rathian are high-ranking predators in the food chain. She is the female land-dwelling counterpart to the male rathalos who patrols the skies. Both will work together to capture prey and ensure the safety of their nest from predators. rathian often target smaller monsters such as {@creature kelbi|MHMM}, {@creature velociprey|MHMM} and {@creature velocidrome|MHMM} that she can easily carry back to her nest, while the stronger rathalos captures more larger herbivores and lesser wyverns instead. Rathian sits in a position directly below her male counterpart and is more likely to be challenged by monsters such as {@creature anjanath|MHMM}, {@creature jyuratodus|MHMM} and {@creature plesioth|MHMM}.

Yet the female fire wyvern is also ready to engage in precarious fights, especially when it concerns the safety of her nest. Her wrath can only be truly overwhelmed by apex predators such as {@creature tigrex|MHMM}, {@creature nargacuga|MHMM}, {@creature zinogre|MHMM} and the aggresive {@creature diablos|MHMM}. In particular, {@creature glavenus|MHMM} are serious competitors of rathian, and gruelling scars found on rathian can often be attributed to an attack from glavenus. Invasive monsters and elder dragons can also prove serious threats to rathian and her nest.

Rathians can survive in almost any territory, but prefers areas with average temperature for nesting. As a result, she is known to be encountered in a large variety of areas such as jungles, sandy plains, and forests.

Rathian is very territorial, choosing to patrol from ground while her Rathalos mate patrols from the sky. She will become very aggressive to potential threats, especially when in close proximity to her nest and young.

items.name: Rathian Scale
entries: While you are wearing this armor, you can use your reaction or bonus action to gain resistance to poison damage until the end of your next turn. You can use this property twice, regaining all uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Flame Sac
entries: Пока вы настроены на этот доспех, вы можете использовать бонусное действие, чтобы произнести его командное слово и выдохнуть огонь на цель в радиусе 15 футов от вас. Цель должна сделать бросок на ловкость {@dc 15}, при неудачном броске она получит {@damage 3d6} урона от огня, при удачном - в два раза меньше.
После использования это свойство нельзя использовать снова, пока вы не закончите длительный отдых.

items.name: Rathian Carapace
entries: You have advantage on checks when attempting to identify poisons while attuned to this armor.

items.name: Rathian Webbing
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition poisoned} condition while you wear this armor.

items.name: Rathian Spike
entries: When you cast a spell that deals acid or poison damage, you gain a +1 bonus to its spell attack roll.

items.name: Rathian Tail
entries: While you wear this armor, you gain 2 additional hit points whenever you regain hit points by magical or non-magical means, except when spending hit dice.

items.name: Rathian Wingtalon
entries: {@i Stamina Surge+1.} While wearing this armor, you can use an action to cast the {@spell haste} spell from it once per day, but can target only yourself when you do so and you gain 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion} when the spell ends.
